es_translation: —I imagine so, my dear - Lord Henry closed the door behind her, when, looking like a bird of paradise that had spent the whole night in the rain, she fluttered out of the room, leaving a faint scent of almond cake; then he lit a cigarette and sank into the sofa.

en: “Why, Harry?”
vi: “Sao lại thế, Harry?”
tr: “O nedenmiş, Harry?”
es: —¿Por qué, Harry?
vi_translation: "Why is that, Harry?"
tr_translation: “Why is that, Harry?”
es_translation: —Why, Harry?

en: “Never marry at all, Dorian. Men marry because they are tired; women, because they are curious: both are disappointed.”
vi: “Đừng cưới xin gì cả, Dorian. Đàn ông cưới vì họ mệt mỏi; đàn bà thì vì họ tò mò; cả hai đều thất vọng.
tr: “Hiç evlenme, Dorian. Erkek, yorgun düştüğü için evlenir, kadın merak duyduğu için. İkisi de hayal kırıklığına uğrarlar.
es: —No te cases, Dorian. Los hombres se casan porque están cansados; las mujeres, porque sienten curiosidad: unos y otras acaban decepcionados.
vi_translation: "Don't get married at all, Dorian. Men marry because they are tired; women because they are curious; both are disappointed."
tr_translation: “Never marry, Dorian. Men marry because they are tired, women because they are curious. Both are disappointed.”
es_translation: —Don't get married, Dorian. Men marry because they are tired; women, because they are curious: both end up disappointed.

en: “I don’t think I am likely to marry, Harry. I am too much in love. That is one of your aphorisms. I am putting it into practice, as I do everything that you say.”
vi: “Tôi không nghĩ là tôi lại có thể cưới, Henry. Tôi quá nặng lòng yêu. Ấy là một trong các châm ngôn của anh. Tôi đã thực hành nó, như tôi vẫn làm mọi điều mà anh nói.
tr: “Benim evlenme olasılığım yok gibi bir şey, Harry. Evlenmeyecek kertede âşığım çünkü. İşte senin aforizmalarından biri. Senin sözünden hiç çıkmadığım için bunu gerçek yaşantımda uygulamaya koyuyorum.
es: —Creo que no es probable que me case, Harry. Estoy demasiado enamorado. Ése es uno de tus aforismos. Lo estoy poniendo en práctica, y hago todo lo que recomiendas.
vi_translation: "I don't think I could ever get married, Henry. I am too heavily in love. That is one of your maxims. I have practiced it, as I always do with everything you say."
tr_translation: “I have almost no chance of getting married, Harry. Because I am in love to the extent that I won't get married. Here is one of your aphorisms. Since I never go against your words, I am putting this into practice in my real life.”
es_translation: —I don't think it's likely that I'll get married, Harry. I'm too much in love. That's one of your aphorisms. I'm putting it into practice, and I'm doing everything you recommend.

en: “Who are you in love with?” asked Lord Henry after a pause.
vi: “Cậu yêu ai?” huân tước Henry hỏi, sau một lúc im lặng.
tr: Lord Henry bir duralamadan sonra, “Kime âşıksın?” diye sordu.
es: —¿De quién te has enamorado? —preguntó lord Henry, después de una pausa.
vi_translation: "Who do you love?" Lord Henry asked, after a moment of silence.
tr_translation: After a pause, Lord Henry asked, "Who are you in love with?"
es_translation: —Who have you fallen in love with? —asked Lord Henry, after a pause.

en: “With an actress,” said Dorian Gray, blushing.
vi: “Một nữ diễn viên,” Dorian Gray nói, đỏ mặt.
tr: Dorian Gray pespembe kesilerek, “Bir tiyatro oyuncusuna,” diye yanıtladı.
es: —De una actriz —dijo Dorian Gray, ruborizándose.
vi_translation: “An actress,” Dorian Gray said, blushing.
tr_translation: Dorian Gray blushingly replied, "To an actress."
es_translation: —From an actress —said Dorian Gray, blushing.

en: Lord Henry shrugged his shoulders. “That is a rather commonplace début.”
vi: Huân tước Henry nhún vai. “Đó là một début khá tầm thường.
tr: Lord Henry omuz silkti. “Çok beylik bir başlangıç bu.
es: Lord Henry se encogió de hombros. —Es un debut bastante corriente.
vi_translation: Lord Henry shrugged. "That was a rather mediocre début."
tr_translation: Lord Henry shrugged his shoulders. "This is a very conventional beginning."
es_translation: Lord Henry shrugged his shoulders. —It's a rather ordinary debut.

en: “You would not say so if you saw her, Harry.”
vi: “Chắc anh sẽ không nói thế nếu anh đã thấy nàng, Harry.”
tr: “Onu görsen böyle demezdin, Harry.
es: —No dirías eso si la vieras, Harry.
vi_translation: "You probably wouldn't say that if you had seen her, Harry."
tr_translation: "If you saw him, you wouldn't say that, Harry.""
es_translation: —You wouldn't say that if you saw her, Harry.

en: “Do you think my nature so shallow?” cried Dorian Gray angrily.
vi: “Anh có nghĩ là bản chất tôi rất nông cạn không?” Dorian Gray la lên, tức giận.
tr: Dorian Gray kızgınlıkla, “Sen benim yaradılışımı bu kadar sığ mı sanıyorsun?” diye bağırdı.
es: —¿Tan superficial me consideras? —exclamó Dorian Gray, muy dolido.
vi_translation: "Do you think that I am very shallow by nature?" Dorian Gray shouted, angry.
tr_translation: Dorian Gray shouted angrily, "Do you think my nature is that shallow?"
es_translation: —Do you consider me that superficial? —exclaimed Dorian Gray, very hurt.

en: “Don’t run down dyed hair and painted faces. There is an extraordinary charm in them, sometimes,” said Lord Henry.
vi: “Đừng chê bai tóc nhuộm mặt vẽ. Có nét duyên lạ ở chúng, đôi khi,” huân tước Henry nói.
tr: “Boyalı saçla boyalı yüzü hor görme,” dedi Lord Henry. “Kimi zaman olağanüstü çekici olabiliyorlar.
es: —No desprecies el pelo teñido y los rostros pintados. En ocasiones tienen un encanto extraordinario —dijo lord Henry.
vi_translation: “Don't criticize dyed hair and painted faces. There is sometimes a strange charm in them,” Lord Henry said.
tr_translation: “Do not scorn painted hair and painted face,” said Lord Henry. “Sometimes they can be extraordinarily attractive.”
es_translation: —Do not disdain dyed hair and painted faces. Sometimes they have an extraordinary charm —said Lord Henry.

en: “You could not have helped telling me, Dorian. All through your life you will tell me everything you do.”
vi: “Cậu không thể không kể cho tôi đâu, Dorian. Rồi suốt đời mình, cậu sẽ kể cho tôi mọi chuyện cậu làm.”
tr: “Anlatmamak elinde değil ki, Dorian. Ömür boyu yaptığın her şeyi bana anlatacaksın sen.
es: —No hubieras podido evitarlo, Dorian. A lo largo de tu vida me contarás todo lo que hagas.
vi_translation: "You can't not tell me, Dorian. For the rest of your life, you will tell me everything you do."
tr_translation: “You can't help but tell, Dorian. You will tell me everything you do for the rest of your life.”
es_translation: —You couldn't have avoided it, Dorian. Throughout your life, you will tell me everything you do.

en: “I know that look. It depresses me,” murmured Lord Henry, examining his rings.
vi: “Tôi biết cái vẻ này. Nó khiến tôi nản lòng,” huân tước Henry lẩm bẩm, săm soi những cái nhẫn của mình.
tr: Lord Henry ellerindeki yüzükleri gözden geçirerek, “Bilirim o tipleri, içimi sıkarlar,” diye mırıldandı.
es: —Conozco ese aspecto. Me deprime —murmuró lord Henry, examinando sus sortijas.
vi_translation: "I know this look. It discourages me," Lord Henry muttered, scrutinizing his rings.
tr_translation: Lord Henry, examining the rings on his fingers, murmured, "I know those types, they bore me."
es_translation: —I know that look. It depresses me —murmured Lord Henry, examining his rings.

en: “And what do you propose to do?” said Lord Henry at last.
vi: “Và cậu định làm gì?” huân tước Henry nói, rốt cuộc.
tr: Lord Henry, “Peki, ne yapmayı planlıyorsun?” diye sordu en sonunda.
es: —Y, ¿qué es lo que te propones hacer? —dijo finalmente lord Henry.
vi_translation: “And what do you intend to do?” Lord Henry said, finally.
tr_translation: Lord Henry asked finally, "Well, what do you plan to do?"
es_translation: —And, what do you intend to do? —said Lord Henry finally.

en: “I want you and Basil to come with me some night and see her act. I have not the slightest fear of the result. You are certain to acknowledge her genius. Then we must get her out of the Jew’s hands. She is bound to him for three years—at least for two years and eight months—from the present time. I shall have to pay him something, of course. When all that is settled, I shall take a West End theatre and bring her out properly. She will make the world as mad as she has made me.”
vi: “Tôi muốn anh và Basil đi cùng tôi một đêm nào đó để xem nàng diễn. Tôi không mảy may sợ hãi kết quả. Anh chắc chắn sẽ công nhận thiên tài của nàng. Sau đó ta phải kéo nàng ra khỏi tay lão Do Thái ấy. Nàng bị trói buộc bởi hợp đồng với lão suốt ba năm — ít nhất là suốt hai năm và tám tháng — từ lúc này. Tôi sẽ phải trả gì đó cho lão, dĩ nhiên. Khi mọi chuyện êm xuôi, tôi sẽ thuê nhà hát West End và đưa nàng ra một cách thích đáng. Nàng sẽ làm cả thế giới phát điên như nàng đã làm với tôi.”
tr: “Basil’le bir gece gelin, onun oyununu görün, istiyorum. Zerrece korkum yok bunun sonucundan. Onun üstün yeteneğini kabul edeceksiniz, bu kesin. Sonra onu o Yahudi’nin ellerinden kurtarmalıyım. Üç yıllık kontratla bağlı ona, yani bugünden sonra iki yıl, sekiz ay. Yahudi’ye bir şeyler ödemem gerekecek, doğallıkla. Bunlar yola girdikten sonra West End’de bir tiyatro tutup Sibyl’i şöyle adam gibi tanıtırım. Bütün dünyayı da, tıpkı beni büyülediği gibi büyüleyecektir.
es: —Quiero que Basil y tú vengáis conmigo alguna noche para verla actuar. No tengo el menor temor al resultado. Sin duda, reconoceréis su genio. Luego hemos de arrancarla de las manos de ese viejo judío. Está atada a él por tres años, al menos dos años y ocho meses, desde el momento presente. Tendré que pagarle algo, por supuesto. Cuando todo esté arreglado, la traeré a algún teatro del West End y la presentaré como es debido. Enloquecerá al mundo como me ha enloquecido a mí.
vi_translation: “I want you and Basil to come with me one night to see her perform. I am not in the least bit afraid of the outcome. You will surely acknowledge her talent. After that, we must get her out of that Jew's hands. She is bound by a contract with him for three years — at least for two years and eight months — from now. I will have to pay him something, of course. When everything is settled, I will rent the West End theater and present her properly. She will drive the whole world crazy as she has done to me.”
tr_translation: “Come one night with Basil, see his play, I want you to. I have no fear at all of the outcome. You will acknowledge his superior talent, this is certain. Then I must save him from that Jew’s hands. He is bound to him by a three-year contract, which means two years and eight months from today. I will have to pay the Jew something, naturally. Once these things are settled, I will rent a theater in West End and properly introduce Sibyl. She will enchant the whole world, just as she has enchanted me.”
es_translation: —I want Basil and you to come with me some night to see her perform. I have no fear of the outcome. Without a doubt, you will recognize her genius. Then we must rescue her from the hands of that old Jew. She is bound to him for three years, at least two years and eight months from now. I will have to pay him something, of course. When everything is settled, I will bring her to some theater in the West End and present her as she deserves. She will drive the world mad as she has driven me mad.

en: “Half-past six! What an hour! It will be like having a meat-tea, or reading an English novel. It must be seven. No gentleman dines before seven. Shall you see Basil between this and then? Or shall I write to him?”
vi: “Sáu rưỡi! Giờ gì thế này! Thế thì có khác gì uống trà thịt, hoặc đọc tiểu thuyết Anh. Phải bảy giờ. Không có người tử tế nào ăn tối trước bảy giờ cả. Cậu sẽ gặp Basil giữa giờ này và giờ sau được chứ? Hay tôi sẽ phải viết cho anh ấy?”
tr: “Altı buçuk ha! Ne tuhaf bir saat! Çay yerine et suyu içmek gibi bir şey ya da bir İngiliz romanı okumak. Yedi yapalım şunu. Hiçbir centilmen yediden önce akşam yemeği yemez. Sen bu arada Basil’i görecek misin, yoksa ben bir not yazayım mı?
es: —¡Seis y media! ¡Qué horas! Sería como tomar una merienda-cena o leer una novela inglesa. Tiene que ser a las siete. Ningún caballero cena antes de las siete. ¿He de ver a Basil de aquí a mañana? ¿O bastará con que le escriba?
vi_translation: “Six-thirty! What kind of time is this! It's no different than having meat tea or reading an English novel. It has to be seven o'clock. No decent person has dinner before seven o'clock. Will you meet Basil between this hour and the next? Or should I write to him?”
tr_translation: “Half past six, ha! What a strange hour! It's like drinking broth instead of tea or reading an English novel. Let's make it seven. No gentleman dines before seven. Will you see Basil in the meantime, or should I write a note?”
es_translation: —Six thirty! What a time! It would be like having a tea-dinner or reading an English novel. It has to be at seven. No gentleman dines before seven. Should I see Basil between now and tomorrow? Or will it be enough to write to him?

en: Lord Henry smiled. “People are very fond of giving away what they need most themselves. It is what I call the depth of generosity.”
vi: Huân tước Henry cười. “Con người rất thích cho đi những gì mà chính họ cần hơn cả. Đó là cái mà tôi gọi là tận cùng rộng lượng.
tr: Lord Henry gülümsedi. “İnsanlar ihtiyaç duydukları şeyleri elden çıkarmaya bayılırlar. Cömertliğin en dibi, diyorum ben buna.
es: Lord Henry sonrió. —A la gente le encanta regalar lo que más necesita. Es lo que yo llamo el insondable abismo de la generosidad.
vi_translation: Lord Henry laughed. "People love to give away what they need most themselves. That is what I call the height of generosity."
tr_translation: Lord Henry smiled. “People love to get rid of the things they need. I call it the height of generosity.”
es_translation: Lord Henry smiled. —People love to give away what they need the most. It is what I call the unfathomable abyss of generosity.

en: “My child, you are far too young to think of falling in love. Besides, what do you know of this young man? You don’t even know his name. The whole thing is most inconvenient, and really, when James is going away to Australia, and I have so much to think of, I must say that you should have shown more consideration. However, as I said before, if he is rich ...”
vi: “Con ơi, con còn quá trẻ để mà nghĩ đến chuyện đắm đuối vì yêu. Vả lại, con biết gì về chàng thanh niên này? Con thậm chí còn chưa biết tên nó. Toàn bộ chuyện này là hết sức phiền phức, và thực ra, khi James sắp bỏ đi Úc, còn mẹ có quá nhiều thứ phải nghĩ đến, mẹ phải nói là con lẽ ra nên tỏ vẻ biết nghĩ hơn. Tuy vậy, như mẹ nói lúc nãy, giả dụ nó giàu...”
tr: “Yavrucuğum, çok küçüksün sen daha, âşık olmayı düşünecek yaşta değilsin. Hem bu genç hakkında ne biliyorsun ki? Adını bile bilmiyorsun onun. Nereden baksan çok uygunsuz bir durum, çok sırasız. Tam James’in Avustralya’ya gideceği şu sıralarda düşünecek dünya kadar sorunum varken senden biraz daha anlayış beklerdim doğrusu. Her neyse, dediğim gibi, eğer bu çocuk paralıysa...
es: —Hijita mía, eres demasiado joven para pensar en enamorarte. Además, ¿qué sabes de ese joven? Ni siquiera su nombre. Todo esto es muy poco conveniente y, a decir verdad, cuando lames está a punto de irse a Australia y yo tengo tantas preocupaciones, he de decir que podrías haber mostrado un poco más de consideración.
vi_translation: "My child, you are still too young to be thinking about being infatuated with love. Moreover, what do you know about this young man? You don't even know his name yet. This whole thing is extremely troublesome, and actually, with James about to leave for Australia, and me having too many things to think about, I must say that you should have shown more consideration. However, as I said earlier, if he were rich..."
tr_translation: “My dear child, you are still very young, you are not at the age to think about falling in love. Besides, what do you know about this young man? You don't even know his name. From any angle, it’s a very inappropriate situation, very untimely. At a time when I have a world of problems to think about, especially with James going to Australia, I would have expected a bit more understanding from you, honestly. Anyway, as I said, if this boy is wealthy...”
es_translation: —My dear daughter, you are too young to think about falling in love. Besides, what do you know about that young man? You don't even know his name. All of this is very inconvenient and, to be honest, when lames is about to go to Australia and I have so many worries, I must say that you could have shown a bit more consideration. However, as I have said before, in the case that he is rich... —Mother, mother!

en: “Society!” muttered the lad. “I don’t want to know anything about that. I should like to make some money to take you and Sibyl off the stage. I hate it.”
vi: “Tầng lớp thượng lưu!” chàng trai lẩm bẩm. “Con chẳng muốn biết gì về cái đó. Con chỉ muốn kiếm chút tiền để đưa mẹ và Sibyl ra khỏi sân khấu. Con ghét nó.”
tr: Çocuk, “Sosyete mi!” diye söylendi. “O konuyla hiç ilgilenmek istemiyorum. Benim istediğim biraz para yapıp seninle Sibyl’i sahneden uzaklaştırmak. Nefret ediyorum sahne yaşantısından.
es: —¡Buena sociedad! —murmuró el muchacho—. No me interesa nada la buena sociedad. Me gustaría ganar algún dinero para sacaros a ti y a Sibyl de los escenarios. Aborrezco la vida del teatro.
vi_translation: "The upper class!" the young man muttered. "I don't want to know anything about that. I just want to make some money to get mother and Sibyl off the stage. I hate it."
tr_translation: The child muttered, “High society!” “I don't want to get involved with that at all. What I want is to make some money and take you and Sibyl away from the stage. I hate the stage life.”
es_translation: —Good society! —murmured the boy—. I am not interested in good society at all. I would like to earn some money to get you and Sibyl off the stage. I abhor the life of the theater.

en: “My son, you distress me very much. Sibyl is always under my special care. Of course, if this gentleman is wealthy, there is no reason why she should not contract an alliance with him. I trust he is one of the aristocracy. He has all the appearance of it, I must say. It might be a most brilliant marriage for Sibyl. They would make a charming couple. His good looks are really quite remarkable; everybody notices them.”
vi: “Con trai của mẹ, con làm mẹ buồn quá. Sibyl luôn được mẹ chăm nom đặc biệt. Dĩ nhiên nếu quý nhân đó giàu có thì chẳng vì lý do nào mà chị con lại không nên kết giao với cậu ta. Mẹ tin cậu ta là một người thuộc tầng lớp quý tộc. Cậu ta có mọi biểu hiện bề ngoài của họ, mẹ phải nói như vậy. Chắc sẽ có một đám cưới rực rỡ cho Sibyl. Chúng nó sẽ thành một đôi tuyệt sắc. Vẻ đẹp của cậu ta thật sự là phi thường; ai ai cũng để ý đến cậu ta.”
tr: “Oğlum, içimi karartıyorsun. Sibyl’e her zaman gözüm gibi bakmışımdır. Bu beyefendi varlıklıysa Sibyl’in onunla bir ilişkiye girmemesi için hiçbir neden yok demektir. Onun aristokrat olduğuna inanıyorum. Görünümü tamamen öyle, inan. Sibyl böylece göz kamaştıran bir evlilik yapabilir. Ne güzel bir çift oluştururlar: Çocuğun olağanüstü bir yakışıklılığı var. Herkesin dikkatini çekiyor.
es: —Hijo mío, me duelen mucho tus palabras. Siempre cuido de Sibyl de manera muy especial. Por supuesto, si ese caballero es rico, no hay razón para que no se case con él. Estoy segura de que se trata de un aristócrata. Tiene todo el aspecto, no hay la menor duda. Sería un matrimonio brillantísimo para Sibyl. Harían una pareja encantadora. Es un muchacho muy apuesto, todo el mundo lo advierte.
vi_translation: “My son, you make me very sad. Sibyl has always received special care from me. Of course, if that gentleman is wealthy, there is no reason why your sister shouldn't associate with him. I believe he belongs to the aristocratic class. He exhibits all the outward signs of it, I must say. There will surely be a splendid wedding for Sibyl. They will make a stunning couple. His beauty is truly extraordinary; everyone notices him.”
tr_translation: “My son, you are darkening my heart. I have always looked after Sibyl like the apple of my eye. If this gentleman is wealthy, there is no reason why Sibyl should not enter into a relationship with him. I believe he is an aristocrat. He completely looks the part, believe me. Thus, Sibyl can make a dazzling marriage. What a beautiful couple they would make: The boy is extraordinarily handsome. He attracts everyone's attention.”
es_translation: —My son, your words hurt me deeply. I always take special care of Sibyl. Of course, if that gentleman is wealthy, there is no reason why she shouldn't marry him. I am sure he is an aristocrat. He has all the appearance, there is no doubt about it. It would be a very brilliant marriage for Sibyl. They would make a charming couple. He is a very handsome young man, everyone notices it.

en: “My child! my child!” cried Mrs. Vane, looking up to the ceiling in search of an imaginary gallery.
vi: “Con tôi! Con tôi!” bà Vane kêu to, ngước nhìn lên trần để tìm một hạng ghế chuồng gà tưởng tượng.
tr: ms Vane, “Yavrum benim! Yavrum!” diye hafifçe bağırdı ve tiyatronun balkonuna bakar gibi gözlerini tavana kaldırdı.
es: —¡Hija mía, hija mía! —exclamó la señora Vane, alzando los ojos al techo en busca de un imaginario anfiteatro.
vi_translation: “My child! My child!” Mrs. Vane cried out, looking up at the ceiling to find an imaginary gallery seat.
tr_translation: Ms. Vane, "My dear! My dear!" she cried softly and lifted her eyes to the ceiling as if looking at the balcony of a theater.
es_translation: —My daughter, my daughter! —exclaimed Mrs. Vane, raising her eyes to the ceiling in search of an imaginary amphitheater.

en: “Stop, Jim!” she exclaimed. “You must not say anything against him. I love him.”
vi: “Thôi, Jim!” nàng la lên. “Em không nên nói gì chống lại anh ấy. Chị yêu anh ấy.”
tr: Kız, “Dur, Jim!” dedi. “Onu kötüleyen hiçbir şey söyleme. Onu seviyorum.
es: —¡No sigas, Jim! —exclamó—. No digas nada contra él. Lo quiero.
vi_translation: “Stop, Jim!” she exclaimed. “I shouldn't say anything against him. I love him.”
tr_translation: The girl said, "Stop, Jim!" "Don't say anything bad about him. I love him."
es_translation: —Don't continue, Jim! —he exclaimed—. Don't say anything against him. I love him.

en: “I can’t believe it. Dorian is far too sensible.”
vi: “Tôi không thể tin được chuyện ấy. Dorian quá khôn ngoan mà.”
tr: “İnanamam. Dorian böyle bir şey yapmayacak kadar aklı başındadır.
es: —No me lo puedo creer. Dorian es demasiado sensato.
vi_translation: "I can't believe that. Dorian is too clever for that."
tr_translation: “I can't believe it. Dorian is sensible enough not to do such a thing.”
es_translation: —I can't believe it. Dorian is too sensible.

en: “Except in America,” rejoined Lord Henry languidly. “But I didn’t say he was married. I said he was engaged to be married. There is a great difference. I have a distinct remembrance of being married, but I have no recollection at all of being engaged. I am inclined to think that I never was engaged.”
vi: “Ngoài Mỹ ra,” huân tước Henry đáp lại, uể oải. “Nhưng tôi không nói cậu ấy đã kết hôn. Tôi nói cậu ấy đã hứa hẹn kết hôn. Sự khác biệt rất lớn. Tôi có một ký ức rất rõ nét về việc kết hôn, nhưng tôi không nhớ được gì cả về chuyện hứa hẹn. Tôi có khuynh hướng nghĩ là mình chưa bao giờ hứa hẹn gì cả.
tr: “Meğer ki Amerika’da olalım,” diye Lord Henry tembel tembel konuştu. “Ben sana onun evlendiğini söylemedim ki. Nişanlanmış, dedim. Arada büyük ayrım var. Ben evlendiğimi açıkça anımsarım da nişanlandığımı zerrece anımsayamam. Hiç nişanlanmadığıma inanacağım gelir çok zaman.
es: —Excepto en los Estados Unidos —replicó lánguidamente lord Henry—. Pero yo no he dicho que se haya casado. He dicho que se ha prometido. Hay una gran diferencia. Recuerdo con mucha claridad estar casado, pero no tengo recuerdo alguno de estar prometido. Me inclino a creer que nunca estuve prometido.
vi_translation: “Except for America,” Lord Henry replied, languidly. “But I did not say he was married. I said he was engaged to be married. There is a great difference. I have a very clear memory of being married, but I remember nothing at all about being engaged. I am inclined to think that I never was engaged.”
tr_translation: “Unless we are in America,” said Lord Henry lazily. “I didn't tell you that he got married. I said he got engaged. There is a big difference between the two. I clearly remember getting married but I can't remember getting engaged at all. Many times, I feel like I never got engaged.”
es_translation: —Except in the United States —replied Lord Henry languidly—. But I did not say that he got married. I said that he got engaged. There is a big difference. I clearly remember being married, but I have no recollection of being engaged. I am inclined to believe that I was never engaged.

en: “And I don’t forgive you for being late for dinner,” broke in Lord Henry, putting his hand on the lad’s shoulder and smiling as he spoke. “Come, let us sit down and try what the new chef here is like, and then you will tell us how it all came about.”
vi: “Và tôi không tha thứ cho cậu vì đến muộn bữa tối,” huân tước Henry ngắt lời, đặt tay lên vai chàng trai, và mỉm cười trong lúc y nói. “Nào, ta hãy ngồi xuống và thử xem đầu bếp mới ở đây thế nào, sau đó cậu sẽ kể cho bọn tôi nghe xem mọi chuyện đã xảy ra thế nào.”
tr: “Ben de seni yemeğe geç kaldığın için bağışlayamıyorum,” diye araya giren Lord Henry elini delikanlının omzuna koydu. Gülümsüyordu. “Buyurun, oturalım da bakalım yeni chef nasılmış görelim. Sen de bize bütün bunların nasıl olup bittiğini anlatırsın.
es: —Y yo no te perdono que llegues tarde a cenar —intervino lord Henry, poniendo una mano en el hombro del muchacho y sonriendo mientras hablaba—. Vamos a sentarnos y a enterarnos de qué tal es el nuevo chef, y luego nos explicarás cómo ha sucedido todo.
vi_translation: “And I do not forgive you for being late for dinner,” Lord Henry interrupted, placing a hand on the young man's shoulder, and smiling as he spoke. “Now, let us sit down and see how the new chef here is, then you will tell us what happened.”
tr_translation: "I can't forgive you for being late to dinner either," said Lord Henry, interrupting and placing his hand on the young man's shoulder. He was smiling. "Come on, let's sit down and see how the new chef is. You can tell us how all this happened."
es_translation: —And I do not forgive you for being late to dinner —interjected Lord Henry, placing a hand on the boy's shoulder and smiling as he spoke—. Let's sit down and find out how the new chef is, and then you can explain to us how everything happened.

en: “Have you seen her to-day?” asked Lord Henry.
vi: “Hôm nay cậu có gặp cô ấy không?” huân tước Henry hỏi.
tr: Lord Henry, “Sibyl’i bugün gördün mü?” diye sordu.
es: —¿La has visto hoy? —preguntó lord Henry.
vi_translation: "Did you see her today?" Lord Henry asked.
tr_translation: Lord Henry asked, "Did you see Sibyl today?"
es_translation: —Have you seen her today? —asked Lord Henry.

en: Dorian Gray shook his head. “I left her in the forest of Arden; I shall find her in an orchard in Verona.”
vi: Dorian Gray lắc đầu. “Tôi để nàng lại trong rừng Arden, tôi sẽ tìm thấy nàng trong một vườn cây ăn trái ở Verona.”
tr: Dorian Gray başını salladı. “Onu Aden Ormanı’nda bıraktım, Verona’da bir meyve bahçesinde bulacağım.
es: Dorian Gray negó con la cabeza. —La dejé en el bosque de Arden y hoy la encontraré en un huerto de Verona.
vi_translation: Dorian Gray shook his head. "I left her in the forest of Arden, I will find her in an orchard in Verona."
tr_translation: Dorian Gray shook his head. “I left it in the Forest of Aden, I will find it in an orchard in Verona.”
es_translation: Dorian Gray shook his head. —I left her in the Forest of Arden and today I will find her in an orchard in Verona.

en: “Women are wonderfully practical,” murmured Lord Henry, “much more practical than we are. In situations of that kind we often forget to say anything about marriage, and they always remind us.”
vi: “Phụ nữ cực kỳ thực dụng,” huân tước Henry lẩm bẩm — "thực dụng hơn nhiều so với chúng ta. Trong những tình huống kiểu đó, ta thường quên nói bất cứ điều gì về hôn nhân, và họ luôn nhắc nhở ta.”
tr: Lord Henry, “Kadınlar olağanüstü pratiktirler,” diye mırıldandı. “Bizden çok daha pratik. Bu gibi durumlarda bizler evlilikten söz açmayı çok zaman unuturuz da onlar hep aklımıza getirirler.
es: —Las mujeres son maravillosamente prácticas —murmuró lord Henry—; mucho más prácticas que nosotros. En situaciones como ésa, olvidamos con frecuencia mencionar la palabra matrimonio, pero ellas nos lo recuerdan siempre.
vi_translation: “Women are extremely practical,” Lord Henry muttered — "much more practical than we are. In those kinds of situations, we often forget to say anything about marriage, and they always remind us.”
tr_translation: Lord Henry murmured, "Women are extraordinarily practical." "Much more practical than we are. In situations like this, we often forget to bring up marriage, but they always remind us."
es_translation: —Women are wonderfully practical —murmured Lord Henry—; much more practical than we are. In situations like that, we often forget to mention the word marriage, but they always remind us.

en: “And those are ...?” asked Lord Henry, helping himself to some salad.
vi: “Và đó là…?” huân tước Henry hỏi, tự phục vụ mình một ít xa-lát.
tr: Lord Henry tabağına biraz salata alarak, “Peki, neymiş bu kuramlar?” diye sordu.
es: —¿Mis teorías...? —preguntó lord Henry, sirviéndose un poco de ensalada.
vi_translation: "And that is...?" Lord Henry asked, serving himself some salad.
tr_translation: Lord Henry, taking some salad onto his plate, asked, "Well, what are these theories?"
es_translation: —My theories...? —asked Lord Henry, serving himself some salad.

en: “Ah! but what do you mean by good?” cried Basil Hallward.
vi: “Ôi! Nhưng ý anh muốn nói gì đối với sự tử tế?” Basil Hallward kêu lên.
tr: Basil Hallward, “Güzel ama iyi insandan kastın nedir?” diye sordu.
es: —Sí, pero, ¿qué quieres decir con bueno? —exclamó Basil Hallward.
vi_translation: “Oh! But what do you mean by kindness?” Basil Hallward exclaimed.
tr_translation: Basil Hallward asked, "What do you mean by a beautiful but good person?"
es_translation: —Yes, but what do you mean by good? —exclaimed Basil Hallward.

en: “But, surely, if one lives merely for one’s self, Harry, one pays a terrible price for doing so?” suggested the painter.
vi: “Nhưng chắc chắn là nếu ta sống chỉ vì mình, Harry, ta sẽ phải trả một cái giá khủng khiếp cho việc đó chứ?” họa sỹ gợi ý
tr: Ressam, “Ama Harry, insan salt kendisi için yaşarsa karşılığında mutlaka müthiş bir bedel ödemez mi?” diye görüşünü belirtti.
es: —Pero, por supuesto, si uno vive tan sólo para uno mismo, ha de pagar un precio terrible por hacerlo, ¿no es cierto, Harry? —preguntó el pintor.
vi_translation: "But surely if we live only for ourselves, Harry, we will have to pay a terrible price for it, won't we?" the artist suggested.
tr_translation: The painter said, "But Harry, if a person lives solely for themselves, don't they inevitably pay a tremendous price in return?"
es_translation: —But, of course, if one lives only for oneself, one must pay a terrible price for it, isn't that right, Harry? —asked the painter.

en: “I know what pleasure is,” cried Dorian Gray. “It is to adore some one.”
vi: “Tôi biết khoái lạc là gì,” Dorian Gray la lên. “Đó là tôn thờ ai đó.”
tr: Dorian, “Keyfin ne olduğunu ben biliyorum!” diye atıldı... “Birine tapınmak.
es: —Yo sé lo que es el placer —exclamó Dorian Gray—. Adorar a alguien.
vi_translation: “I know what pleasure is,” Dorian Gray exclaimed. “It is to adore someone.”
tr_translation: Dorian exclaimed, "I know what pleasure is!" "Worshiping someone."
es_translation: —I know what pleasure is —exclaimed Dorian Gray—. To adore someone.

en: “Nothing is ever quite true,” said Lord Henry.
vi: “Chẳng có điều gì từng hoàn toàn đúng cả,” huân tước Henry nói.
tr: Lord Henry, “Hiçbir şey tam anlamıyla doğru değildir,” diye fikir yürüttü.
es: —Nada es completamente cierto —dijo lord Henry.
vi_translation: “Nothing has ever been completely right,” Lord Henry said.
tr_translation: Lord Henry speculated, "Nothing is completely true."
es_translation: —Nothing is completely certain —said Lord Henry.

en: “What a place to find one’s divinity in!” said Lord Henry.
vi: “Thật là một nơi ra gì để tìm thánh nữ!” huân tước Henry nói.
tr: Lord Henry, “Tam da kişinin tanrıçasını bulacağı yer!” dedi.
es: —¡Qué lugar para encontrar a una diosa! —dijo lord Henry.
vi_translation: “What a place to find a saint!” Lord Henry said.
tr_translation: Lord Henry, "Just the place where one would find their goddess!" he said.
es_translation: —What a place to find a goddess! —said Lord Henry.

en: “The same flesh and blood as one’s self! Oh, I hope not!” exclaimed Lord Henry, who was scanning the occupants of the gallery through his opera-glass.
vi: “Cũng từ cùng thứ máu thịt như bản thân ta! Ôi, tôi mong là không!” huân tước Henry la lên, y đang dõi mắt nhìn các khách hạng chuồng gà qua chiếc ống nhòm nhà hát.
tr: Öyle ki insana onlar da bizimle aynı eti, aynı kanı taşıyorlarmış gibi geliyor. Dürbünüyle balkondakileri gözden geçirmekte olan Lord Henry, “Bizimle aynı et ve kan mı! Sakın ha!” diye bağırdı.
es: —¡La misma carne y sangre que nosotros! ¡Espero que no! —exclamó lord Henry, que observaba a los ocupantes del paraíso con sus gemelos de teatro.
vi_translation: “Also made of the same flesh and blood as myself! Oh, I hope not!” Lord Henry exclaimed, as he was watching the gallery patrons through the opera glasses.
tr_translation: So much so that it feels like they carry the same flesh and blood as us." Lord Henry, who was surveying the people on the balcony with his binoculars, exclaimed, "The same flesh and blood as us! Never!"
es_translation: —The same flesh and blood as us! I hope not! —exclaimed Lord Henry, who was observing the occupants of the paradise with his opera glasses.

en: Yet they felt that the true test of any Juliet is the balcony scene of the second act. They waited for that. If she failed there, there was nothing in her.
vi: Song họ cảm thấy rằng phép thử thực sự cho mọi Juliet là cảnh ban-công ở hồi hai. Họ chờ lúc ấy. Nếu nàng lại hỏng ở đấy, thì chẳng có tài năng gì ở nàng cả.
tr: Gene de bütün Julietlerin gerçek sınavının ikinci perdedeki balkon sahnesi olduğuna inanıyor, bunu bekliyorlardı. Kız bunda da başarısız olursa hiçbir yeteneği yok demekti.
es: De todos modos, comprendían que la verdadera prueba de cualquier Julieta es la escena del balcón en el segundo acto. Esperarían a que llegara. Si fallaba allí, todo habría acabado.
vi_translation: They felt that the true test for any Juliet was the balcony scene in act two. They waited for that moment. If she failed there, then she had no talent at all.
tr_translation: Gene believed that the real test for all Juliets was the balcony scene in the second act, and they were waiting for it. If the girl failed in this as well, it meant she had no talent at all.
es_translation: In any case, they understood that the true test for any Juliet is the balcony scene in the second act. They would wait for it to arrive. If she failed there, everything would be over.

en: “Don’t talk like that about any one you love, Dorian. Love is a more wonderful thing than art.”
vi: “Đừng nói như vậy về bất cứ ai cậu yêu, Dorian. Ái tình là điều diệu kỳ hơn Nghệ thuật.”
tr: “Sevdiklerin konusunda bu biçimde konuşma, Dorian. Sevgi sanattan daha üstün bir şeydir.
es: —No hables así de alguien a quien amas, Dorian. El amor es más maravilloso que el arte.
vi_translation: “Don't speak that way about anyone you love, Dorian. Love is a more wonderful thing than Art.”
tr_translation: "Don't talk about your loved ones in this manner, Dorian. Love is something superior to art."
es_translation: —Don't speak like that about someone you love, Dorian. Love is more wonderful than art.

en: When he entered, she looked at him, and an expression of infinite joy came over her. “How badly I acted to-night, Dorian!” she cried.
vi: Khi cậu vào, nàng nhìn cậu, và một vẻ mừng vui vô bờ bến hiện lên ở nàng. “Sao mà đêm nay em diễn dở đến thế, Dorian!” nàng la lên.
tr: Dorian içeri girince kız ona baktı, yüzüne sonsuz bir kıvanç yayıldı. “Dorian, ne kötü bir oyun çıkardım bu gece!
es: Al entrar Dorian, la muchacha lo miró y apareció en su rostro una expresión de infinita alegría. —¡Qué mal he actuado esta noche, Dorian! —exclamó.
vi_translation: When he entered, she looked at him, and an expression of boundless joy appeared on her face. “Why did you perform so poorly tonight, Dorian!” she exclaimed.
tr_translation: When Dorian entered, the girl looked at him, and an infinite joy spread across her face. "Dorian, I gave a terrible performance tonight!""
es_translation: As Dorian entered, the girl looked at him and an expression of infinite joy appeared on her face. —How badly I acted tonight, Dorian! —she exclaimed.

en: He winced and, taking up from the table an oval glass framed in ivory Cupids, one of Lord Henry’s many presents to him, glanced hurriedly into its polished depths. No line like that warped his red lips. What did it mean?
vi: Cậu rụt lại, và, nhặt lên khỏi bàn một chiếc gương hình ô-van được đóng khung bằng các thần Cupid ngà voi, một trong nhiều món quà mà huân tước Henry tặng cậu, vội vã nhìn vào đáy sâu bóng loáng của nó. Không vết nhăn nào như cái đã làm méo mó đôi môi đỏ của cậu. Vậy nghĩa là sao?
tr: Delikanlı irkilerek gözlerini kırpıştırdı. Masanın üzerinden, Lord Henry’nin sayısız armağanlarından biri olan, fildişi Cupidlerle çevrelenmiş oval bir ayna alarak, sırlı derinliklerine telaşla göz attı. Kırmızı dudaklarını çirkinleştiren öyle bir çizgi yoktu ki! Ne demek oluyordu bu?
es: Estremecido, tomó de la mesa un espejo oval, encuadrado por cupidos de marfil, uno de los muchos regalos que lord Henry le había hecho, y lanzó una mirada rápida a sus brillantes profundidades. Ninguna arruga parecida había deformado sus labios rojos. ¿Qué significaba aquello?
vi_translation: He drew back, and, picking up from the table an oval mirror framed with ivory Cupids, one of the many gifts Lord Henry had given him, hurriedly looked into its glossy depths. There was no wrinkle such as the one that had distorted his red lips. What did it mean?
tr_translation: The young man flinched and blinked his eyes. He took an oval mirror surrounded by ivory Cupids, one of Lord Henry's numerous gifts, from the table and anxiously looked into its reflective depths. There was no such line that disfigured his red lips! What did this mean?
es_translation: Trembling, he took from the table an oval mirror, framed by ivory cupids, one of the many gifts Lord Henry had given him, and cast a quick glance at its bright depths. No similar wrinkle had deformed his red lips. What did it mean?

en: Dorian shook his head. “I am not cold,” he murmured.
vi: Dorian lắc đầu. “Tôi không lạnh,” cậu lẩm bẩm.
tr: Dorian başını sarsarak, “Üşümüyorum,” diye mırıldandı.
es: Dorian negó con un movimiento de cabeza. —No tengo frío —murmuró.
vi_translation: Dorian shook his head. "I'm not cold," he muttered.
tr_translation: Shaking his head, Dorian murmured, "I'm not cold."
es_translation: Dorian shook his head. —I'm not cold —he murmured.

en: “Yes, of course,” answered Lord Henry, sinking into a chair and slowly pulling off his yellow gloves. “It is dreadful, from one point of view, but it was not your fault. Tell me, did you go behind and see her, after the play was over?”
vi: “Vâng, dĩ nhiên,” huân tước Henry trả lời, hạ mình xuống ghế, chầm chậm tháo đôi găng tay vàng ra. “Thật kinh khủng, dưới quan điểm nào đó, nhưng đấy không phải lỗi của cậu. Hãy kể cho tôi, cậu có đi ra sau và gặp cô ấy không, sau khi vở kịch kết thúc ấy?” “Có.”
tr: Lord Henry, “Evet, elbette,” diyerek bir koltuğa çöktü, sarı eldivenlerini ağır ağır çıkarmaya girişti. “Feci bir şey bir bakıma ama suç sende değildi. Söyle bana, oyun bittikten sonra kulise gidip gördün mü onu? “Evet.
es: —Sí, por supuesto —respondió lord Henry, dejándose caer en una silla y quitándose lentamente los guantes amarillos—. Es horrible, desde cierto punto de vista, pero tú no tienes la culpa. Dime, ¿fuiste a verla después de que terminara la obra? —Sí.
vi_translation: “Yes, of course,” Lord Henry replied, lowering himself into a chair and slowly removing his yellow gloves. “It's terrible, in a way, but it's not your fault. Tell me, did you go backstage and see her after the play ended?”
tr_translation: Lord Henry, "Yes, of course," he said, sinking into a chair and slowly starting to remove his yellow gloves. "It's a terrible thing in a way, but it wasn't your fault. Tell me, did you go backstage and see her after the play was over?"
es_translation: —Yes, of course —replied Lord Henry, dropping into a chair and slowly removing his yellow gloves—. It is horrible, from a certain point of view, but it is not your fault. Tell me, did you go to see her after the play was over?

en: “I was brutal, Harry—perfectly brutal. But it is all right now. I am not sorry for anything that has happened. It has taught me to know myself better.”
vi: “Tôi cục súc thật, Harry — cực kỳ cục súc. Nhưng giờ thì ổn cả rồi. Tôi không hối tiếc với bất cứ chuyện gì đã xảy ra. Nó dạy cho tôi hiểu mình hơn.”
tr: “Hayvancasına, Harry, resmen hayvancasına. Ama her şey yoluna girdi artık. Olup bitenlerden ötürü çok pişmanım. Bana kendi kendimi çok daha iyi tanımasını öğretti.
es: —Fui brutal, Harry, terriblemente brutal. Pero ahora todo está resuelto. No siento lo que ha sucedido. Me ha enseñado a conocerme mejor.
vi_translation: "I was really rough, Harry — extremely rough. But now everything is fine. I don't regret anything that happened. It taught me to understand myself better."
tr_translation: “Like an animal, Harry, literally like an animal. But everything is fine now. I'm very sorry for what happened. It taught me to know myself much better.”
es_translation: —I was brutal, Harry, terribly brutal. But now everything is resolved. I don't regret what happened. It has taught me to know myself better.

en: “Your letter? Oh, yes, I remember. I have not read it yet, Harry. I was afraid there might be something in it that I wouldn’t like. You cut life to pieces with your epigrams.”
vi: “Thư của anh? À, vâng, tôi nhớ rồi. Tôi còn chưa đọc nó, Harry. Tôi sợ là có thể có gì đó trong ấy mà tôi không thích. Anh cắt đời vụn ra bằng các châm ngôn trào phúng của anh.”
tr: “Mektubun mu? Ha evet! Daha okumamıştım Harry. Hoşuma gitmeyecek bir şey yazmışsındır, diye korktum. Sen şu özdeyişlerinle hayatı lokma lokma doğruyorsun da.
es: —¿Tu carta? Ah, sí, ya recuerdo. No la he leído aún, Harry. Temía que hubiera en ella algo que me disgustara. Cortas la vida en pedazos con tus epigramas.
vi_translation: “Your letter? Ah, yes, I remember now. I haven't read it yet, Harry. I'm afraid there might be something in it that I don't like. You dissect life with your satirical maxims.”
tr_translation: “Your letter? Oh yes! I hadn't read it yet, Harry. I was afraid you might have written something I wouldn't like. You always dissect life bit by bit with your aphorisms.”
es_translation: —Your letter? Ah, yes, now I remember. I haven't read it yet, Harry. I was afraid there might be something in it that would upset me. You cut life into pieces with your epigrams.

en: “It is an interesting question,” said Lord Henry, who found an exquisite pleasure in playing on the lad’s unconscious egotism, “an extremely interesting question. I fancy that the true explanation is this: It often happens that the real tragedies of life occur in such an inartistic manner that they hurt us by their crude violence, their absolute incoherence, their absurd want of meaning, their entire lack of style. They affect us just as vulgarity affects us. They give us an impression of sheer brute force, and we revolt against that. Sometimes, however, a tragedy that possesses artistic elements of beauty crosses our lives. If these elements of beauty are real, the whole thing simply appeals to our sense of dramatic effect. Suddenly we find that we are no longer the actors, but the spectators of the play. Or rather we are both. We watch ourselves, and the mere wonder of the spectacle enthralls us. In the present case, what is it that has really happened? Some one has killed herself for love of you. I wish that I had ever had such an experience. It would have made me in love with love for the rest of my life. The people who have adored me—there have not been very many, but there have been some—have always insisted on living on, long after I had ceased to care for them, or they to care for me. They have become stout and tedious, and when I meet them, they go in at once for reminiscences. That awful memory of woman! What a fearful thing it is! And what an utter intellectual stagnation it reveals! One should absorb the colour of life, but one should never remember its details. Details are always vulgar.”
vi: “Đó là một câu hỏi thú vị,” huân tước Henry nói, y thấy một niềm vui tao nhã trong việc chơi đùa với tính vị kỷ vô thức của chàng trai — “một câu hỏi cực kỳ thú vị. Tôi nghĩ rằng lời giải thích chính xác là thế này. Một điều thường xảy ra là các bi kịch thật sự trong đời lại xuất hiện theo một lối phản nghệ thuật đến nỗi chúng làm tổn thương ta bằng sự hung hãn thô bạo, sự rời rạc tuyệt đối, sự vô nghĩa phi lý, sự thiếu vắng phong cách. Chúng ảnh hưởng đến ta hệt như sự thô tục ảnh hưởng đến ta. Chúng cho ta một ấn tượng về sức mạnh hung ác tuyệt đối, và ta cưỡng lại chúng. Tuy nhiên, đôi lúc, một bi kịch có các yếu tố nghệ thuật đẹp đẽ cắt ngang đời ta. Nếu những yếu tố đẹp đẽ này là thật, thì toàn bộ sự việc rất dễ hấp dẫn khả năng cảm nhận của ta về hiệu ứng kịch. Đột nhiên ta thấy rằng ta không còn là diễn viên nữa, mà là các khán giả của vở kịch. Hoặc đúng hơn thì ta là cả hai. Ta xem chính mình, và chính nỗi ngạc nhiên với sự trình diễn này đã mê hoặc ta. Trong cảnh ngộ hiện thời, chuyện gì đã thực sự xảy ra? Có người tự sát vì yêu cậu. Ước gì tôi có lúc được hưởng một trải nghiệm như vậy. Nó sẽ khiến tôi đem lòng yêu tình yêu suốt quãng đời còn lại của mình. Những người từng mê tôi — không nhiều lắm, nhưng cũng có một số — luôn nhất định sống tiếp, rất lâu sau khi tôi đã thôi quan tâm đến họ, hoặc họ quan tâm đến tôi. Họ đẫy ra, nhạt đi, và khi tôi gặp lại họ thì họ lập tức trôi vào kỷ niệm. Cái ký ức kinh dị ấy về đàn bà! Nó là một thứ đáng sợ biết bao! Và nó để lộ ra một tình trạng mụ mẫm trí tuệ triệt để làm sao! Ta nên hấp thu sắc màu cuộc sống, nhưng đừng bao giờ nhớ các chi tiết của nó. Các chi tiết luôn thô tục.”
tr: Delikanlının bilinçsiz bencilliğini kışkırtmaktan büyük ve gizli bir tat alan Lord Henry, “İlginç bir sorun bu, son derece ilginç,” dedi. “Bana öyle geliyor ki gerçek açıklaması şöyle: Çoğu zaman hayatın gerçek trajedileri sanat ölçülerinden öyle uzaktırlar ki içerdikleri kaba şiddetle, tutarsızlıklarıyla, anlamdan yoksun oluşlarının gülünçlüğüyle, zariflikten, kıvraklıktan yoksun oluşlarıyla bizi incitirler. Tıpkı kalabalığın etkisi gibidir üzerimizdeki etkileri. Katıksız bir kaba kuvvet izlenimi bırakırlar üzerimizde, biz de buna başkaldırırız. Öte yandan, arada bir, sanatsal güzellik öğeleri taşıyan bir trajedi hayatımıza girer. Bu güzellik öğeleri sahiciyse olay bizi doğrudan, dramatik yapısı yönünden etkiler. Birden bakarız ki artık oyuncu olmaktan çıkmış, oyunun seyircisi olmuşuz. Daha doğrusu hem oyuncuyuzdur hem seyirci. Kendi kendimizi seyrederiz de gösterideki olağanüstülüğe kapılır gideriz. Bu olayda olan da nedir gerçekte? Bir kız senin aşkın uğruna kendini öldürmüş. Keşke ben de yaşamış olsaydım böyle bir şeyi. Ömür boyu aşka âşık ederdi beni. Bana tapan kişiler... sayıları pek çok olmasa da... benim onlara ya da onların bana... duyduğumuz ilgi söndükten çok sonralara kadar hayatta kalmakta direttiler hep. Şişmanlayıp bezdirici kişiler oldular. Karşılaştığımız zaman da hemen eski anıları canlandırmaya girişiyorlar. Ah, kadının o müthiş belleği! Ne korkunç şeydir o! Nasıl katıksız bir zihin yosunlaşmasını ortaya vurur! İnsan yaşamın rengini emmeli de ayrıntılarını asla hatırlamamalı. Ayrıntılar her zaman avam işidir.
es: —Es un caso interesante —dijo lord Henry, que encontraba un placer sutil enjugar con el egoísmo inconsciente de su joven amigo—; un caso sumamente interesante. Creo que la verdadera explicación es ésta: sucede con frecuencia que las tragedias reales de la vida ocurren de una manera tan poco artística que nos hieren por lo crudo de su violencia, por su absoluta incoherencia, su absurda ausencia de significado, su completa falta de estilo. Nos afectan como lo hace la vulgaridad. Sólo nos producen una impresión de fuerza bruta, y nos rebelamos contra eso. A veces, sin embargo, cruza nuestras vidas una tragedia que posee elementos de belleza artística. Si esos elementos de belleza son reales, todo el conjunto apela a nuestro sentido del efecto dramático. De repente descubrimos que ya no somos los actores, sino los espectadores de la obra. O que somos más bien las dos cosas. Nos observamos, y el mero asombro del espectáculo nos seduce. En el caso presente, ¿qué es lo que ha sucedido en realidad? Alguien se ha matado por amor tuyo. Me gustaría haber tenido alguna vez una experiencia semejante. Me hubiera hecho enamorarme del amor para el resto de mi vida. Las personas que me han adorado (no han sido muchas, pero sí algunas), siempre han insistido en seguir viviendo después de que yo dejase de quererlas y ellas dejaran de quererme a mí. Se han vuelto corpulentas y tediosas, y cuando me encuentro con ellas se lanzan inmediatamente a los recuerdos. ¡Ah, esa terrible memoria de las mujeres! ¡Qué cosa más espantosa! ¡Y qué total estancamiento intelectual revela! Se deben absorberlos colores de la vida, pero nunca recordar los detalles. Los detalles siempre son vulgares.
vi_translation: “That is an interesting question,” Lord Henry said, finding a refined pleasure in playing with the unconscious selfishness of the young man — “a very interesting question. I think the correct explanation is this. It often happens that the real tragedies in life occur in such an anti-artistic manner that they hurt us with their brutal aggression, absolute disjointedness, absurd senselessness, and lack of style. They affect us just as vulgarity affects us. They give us an impression of absolute malicious power, and we resist them. However, sometimes, a tragedy with beautiful artistic elements intersects our lives. If these beautiful elements are real, then the whole affair easily captivates our sense of dramatic effect. Suddenly we find that we are no longer actors, but the audience of the play. Or rather, we are both. We watch ourselves, and it is the very surprise of this performance that fascinates us. In the current situation, what has actually happened? Someone has committed suicide because they loved you. I wish I could have such an experience sometime. It would make me love love for the rest of my life. The people who have been infatuated with me — not many, but there have been some — always insisted on living on, long after I had ceased to care for them, or they for me. They fade away, become dull, and when I meet them again, they immediately drift into memory. That dreadful memory of women! How terrifying it is! And how it reveals a state of complete intellectual dullness! We should absorb the colors of life, but never remember its details. The details are always vulgar.”
tr_translation: Lord Henry, who took great and secret pleasure in provoking the young man's unconscious selfishness, said, "This is an interesting problem, extremely interesting." " It seems to me that the real explanation is this: Often, the real tragedies of life are so far removed from the standards of art that they hurt us with their crude violence, their inconsistencies, the absurdity of their lack of meaning, their lack of elegance and grace. They affect us much like a crowd does. They leave us with an impression of pure brute force, and we rebel against it. On the other hand, occasionally, a tragedy with elements of artistic beauty enters our lives. If these elements of beauty are genuine, the event affects us directly, in terms of its dramatic structure. Suddenly, we find that we are no longer actors, but spectators of the play. Or rather, we are both actors and spectators. We watch ourselves and get carried away by the extraordinariness of the spectacle. So what has really happened in this event? A girl has killed herself for your love. I wish I had experienced something like that. It would have made me fall in love with love for a lifetime. The people who adored me...though they were not many in number...always insisted on surviving long after the interest I had in them or they had in me had faded. They became fat and tiresome people. Whenever we met, they immediately started to revive old memories. Ah, the terrible memory of a woman! What a dreadful thing it is! How it reveals the pure mossiness of the mind! One should absorb the color of life but never remember its details. Details are always the business of the vulgar."
es_translation: —It is an interesting case —said Lord Henry, who found a subtle pleasure in playing with the unconscious selfishness of his young friend—; a most interesting case. I believe the true explanation is this: it often happens that the real tragedies of life occur in such an unartistic manner that they wound us by the rawness of their violence, by their absolute incoherence, their absurd lack of meaning, their complete lack of style. They affect us as vulgarity does. They only leave us with an impression of brute force, and we rebel against that. Sometimes, however, a tragedy crosses our lives that possesses elements of artistic beauty. If those elements of beauty are real, the entire ensemble appeals to our sense of dramatic effect. Suddenly we discover that we are no longer the actors, but the spectators of the play. Or rather that we are both things. We observe ourselves, and the mere wonder of the spectacle seduces us. In the present case, what has really happened? Someone has killed themselves for love of you. I would have liked to have had such an experience once. It would have made me fall in love with love for the rest of my life. The people who have adored me (there have not been many, but a few), have always insisted on continuing to live after I stopped loving them and they stopped loving me. They have become corpulent and tedious, and when I meet them, they immediately dive into memories. Ah, that terrible memory of women! What a dreadful thing! And what total intellectual stagnation it reveals! One should absorb the colors of life, but never remember the details. The details are always vulgar.

en: “I must sow poppies in my garden,” sighed Dorian.
vi: “Tôi phải gieo thuốc phiện trong vườn nhà mình,” Dorian thở dài.
tr: Dorian, “Bahçeme haşhaş ekmeliyim,” diyerek içini çekti.
es: —He de sembrar amapolas en el jardín —suspiró Dorian.
vi_translation: “I have to plant opium in my own garden,” Dorian sighed.
tr_translation: Dorian sighed, "I should plant poppies in my garden."
es_translation: —I must plant poppies in the garden —sighed Dorian.

en: “Life has everything in store for you, Dorian. There is nothing that you, with your extraordinary good looks, will not be able to do.”
vi: “Cuộc sống còn dành sẵn mọi thứ cho cậu, Dorian. Chẳng có gì mà cậu, với vẻ đẹp đặc biệt của mình, lại không thể làm.
tr: “Hayat senin için her şeyi hazırlıyor, Dorian. Bu olağanüstü güzelliğinle senin yapamayacağın şey yok.
es: —La vida te lo reserva todo, Dorian. No hay nada que no seas capaz de hacer, con tu maravillosa belleza.
vi_translation: "Life still has everything ready for you, Dorian. There is nothing that you, with your exceptional beauty, cannot do."
tr_translation: “Life is preparing everything for you, Dorian. With this extraordinary beauty of yours, there is nothing you cannot do.”
es_translation: —Life has everything in store for you, Dorian. There is nothing you are not capable of doing, with your marvelous beauty.

en: “Stop, Basil! I won’t hear it!” cried Dorian, leaping to his feet. “You must not tell me about things. What is done is done. What is past is past.”
vi: “Thôi, Basil! Tôi sẽ không chịu1 được!” Dorian la lớn, đứng phắt dậy. “Anh không nên nói với tôi về các chuyện ấy nữa. Cái gì xong là xong. Cái gì đã qua là quá khứ.” 1 Một điểm tranh cãi ở bản thảo viết tay rất khó đọc của tác giả, nhiều bản in tiếng Anh cho rằng từ này là “hear/nghe.” Tuy nhiên, người dịch chọn phương án dịch theo “bear/chịu.”
tr: “Sus, Basil! Dinlemeyeceğim!” diye bağıran Dorian yerinden fırladı. “Anlatmayacaksın bana böyle şeyler. Olan olmuş. Geçmiş geçmiştir.
es: —¡Basta! ¡No estoy dispuesto a escucharlo! —exclamó Dorian, poniéndose en pie con brusquedad—. No me hables de esas cosas. Lo que está hecho, está hecho. Lo pasado, pasado está.
vi_translation: "Enough, Basil! I can't bear it any longer!" Dorian shouted, standing up abruptly. "You shouldn't talk to me about these things anymore. What's done is done. What's past is past." 1 One point of contention in the author's very hard-to-read handwritten manuscript is that many English prints suggest this word is “hear.” However, the translator chose the translation as “bear.”
tr_translation: “Stop, Basil! I won't listen!” shouted Dorian as he jumped up. “You won't tell me such things. What's done is done. The past is the past.”
es_translation: —Enough! I am not willing to listen to it! —exclaimed Dorian, standing up abruptly—. Do not talk to me about those things. What is done, is done. The past is the past.

en: “I want the Dorian Gray I used to paint,” said the artist sadly.
vi: “Tôi muốn Dorian Gray mà tôi từng vẽ,” nghệ sỹ nói, buồn bã.
tr: Ressam, “Resmini çizdiğim o Dorian Gray’i istiyorum,” diye üzüntüyle yanıtladı.
es: —Quiero al Dorian Gray cuyo retrato pinté en otro tiempo —dijo el artista con tristeza.
vi_translation: "I want the Dorian Gray that I once painted," the artist said sadly.
tr_translation: The painter replied sorrowfully, "I want the Dorian Gray I painted in that picture."
es_translation: "I want the Dorian Gray whose portrait I painted long ago," said the artist sadly.

en: “Killed herself! Good heavens! is there no doubt about that?” cried Hallward, looking up at him with an expression of horror.
vi: “Tự sát! Trời ơi! Có chắc chắn về việc ấy không?” Hallward kêu lên, ngước nhìn cậu với vẻ sợ hãi.
tr: Basil Hallward, “Kendini mi öldürmüş? Aman Tanrım! Kesin mi bu?” diye hafifçe bağırarak, dehşet dolu bir yüzle gence baktı.
es: —¡Quitado la vida! ¡Cielo santo! ¿Se sabe a ciencia cierta? —exclamó Hallward, mirando horrorizado a su amigo.
vi_translation: “Suicide! Oh my God! Are you sure about that?” Hallward cried out, looking up at him with a fearful expression.
tr_translation: Basil Hallward, "Did he kill himself? Oh my God! Is it certain?" he exclaimed softly, looking at the young man with a face full of horror.
es_translation: —Taken his life! Good heavens! Is it known for certain? —exclaimed Hallward, looking horrified at his friend.

en: Dorian shook his head, and a look of annoyance passed over his face at the mention of the word “inquest.” There was something so crude and vulgar about everything of the kind. “They don’t know my name,” he answered.
vi: Dorian lắc đầu và một vẻ khó chịu lướt ngang mặt cậu khi nghe nhắc đến từ “cuộc điều tra.” Có gì đó thô bạo và tầm thường ở mọi thứ đại loại như vậy. “Họ không biết tên tôi,” cậu trả lời.
tr: Dorian başını salladı. Sorgulama lafını duyunca yüzünden bir hoşnutsuzluk gelip geçmişti. Bu gibi şeylerde öyle kaba, öyle bayağı bir yön vardı ki! “Adımı bilmiyorlar.
es: Dorian negó con la cabeza; y una expresión de fastidio pasó por su rostro al oír mencionar la palabra «investigación». Todo aquel asunto tenía algo de vulgar y de tosco. —No saben cómo me llamo —respondió.
vi_translation: Dorian shook his head, and a look of discomfort crossed his face at the mention of the word "investigation." There was something crude and vulgar about everything of that sort. "They don't know my name," he replied.
tr_translation: Dorian nodded. When he heard the word "interrogation," a look of displeasure crossed his face. There was something so crude, so vulgar about such matters! “They don't know my name.”
es_translation: Dorian shook his head; and an expression of annoyance crossed his face upon hearing the word "investigation" mentioned. The whole affair had something vulgar and coarse about it. —They don't know my name —he replied.

en: “I will try and do something, Dorian, if it would please you. But you must come and sit to me yourself again. I can’t get on without you.”
vi: “Tôi sẽ cố thử làm gì đó, Dorian, nếu nó làm cậu vui. Nhưng chính cậu phải đến ngồi làm mẫu lại cho tôi. Tôi không thể làm tiếp nếu thiếu cậu.”
tr: “Bir şeyler yapmaya çalışırım, Dorian, mademki seni sevindirecek. Ama sen de gelip bana yeniden poz vereceksin. Sensiz çalışamıyorum.
es: —Trataré de hacer algo, Dorian, si eso te agrada. Pero tienes que venir y posar para mí de nuevo. Sin ti no hago nada que merezca la pena.
vi_translation: "I will try to do something, Dorian, if it makes you happy. But you must come and sit for me again. I can't continue without you."
tr_translation: “I will try to do something, Dorian, if it will make you happy. But you must come and pose for me again. I can't work without you.”
es_translation: —I will try to do something, Dorian, if that pleases you. But you have to come and pose for me again. Without you, I do nothing worthwhile.

en: “Not look at my own work! You are not serious. Why shouldn’t I look at it?” exclaimed Hallward, laughing.
vi: “Không nhìn tác phẩm của tôi! Cậu không nghiêm túc. Sao tôi lại không được nhìn nó?” Hallward la lên, bật cười.
tr: Hallward gülerek, “Kendi yaptığım resme bakmayacak mıyım yani? Ciddi olamazsın!” dedi. “Neden bakmayacakmışım?
es: —¡Que no vea mi propia obra! No hablas en serio. ¿Por qué tendría que no verlo? —preguntó Hallward, riendo.
vi_translation: "Don't look at my work! You're not serious. Why can't I look at it?" Hallward exclaimed, laughing.
tr_translation: Hallward laughed, "Am I not going to look at the painting I made myself? You can't be serious!" he said. "Why wouldn't I look at it?"
es_translation: —I must not see my own work! You're not serious. Why shouldn't I see it? —asked Hallward, laughing.

en: “To exhibit it! You want to exhibit it?” exclaimed Dorian Gray, a strange sense of terror creeping over him. Was the world going to be shown his secret? Were people to gape at the mystery of his life? That was impossible. Something—he did not know what—had to be done at once.
vi: “Triển lãm nó? Anh muốn triển lãm nó?” Dorian Gray la lên, một cảm giác khiếp sợ kỳ lạ râm ran khắp người cậu. Có phải cả thế giới sắp được cho xem bí mật của cậu? Có phải tất cả mọi người sắp há miệng nhìn điều bí ẩn của đời cậu? Không thể nào. Một việc gì đó — cậu không biết là gì — phải được làm ngay lập tức.
tr: Dorian, “Sergilemek mi? Sergiye mi sokmak istiyorsun?” diye hafifçe bağırarak sordu. İçini tuhaf bir ürkü bürümüştü. Yani onun gizi tüm dünyaya gösterilecek miydi? Herkes onun yaşamının esrarını mı seyredecekti aval aval? Olamazdı bu. Hemencecik bir şeyler... ne olduğunu bilemiyordu ya... yapmak gerekti.
es: —¿Exponerlo? ¿Quieres exponerlo? —exclamó Dorian Gray, sintiendo que le invadía un extraño terror. ¿Iba a ser el mundo testigo de su secreto? ¿Se quedaría la gente con la boca abierta ante el misterio de su vida? Imposible. Había que hacer algo, no sabía aún qué, y hacerlo de inmediato.
vi_translation: “Exhibit it? You want to exhibit it?” Dorian Gray exclaimed, a strange feeling of dread tingling throughout his body. Is the whole world about to see his secret? Is everyone about to gape at the mystery of his life? Impossible. Something — he didn't know what — had to be done immediately.
tr_translation: Dorian, "Exhibit it? Do you want to put it in an exhibition?" he asked, shouting slightly. A strange chill enveloped him. So, would his secret be shown to the whole world? Would everyone gawk at the mystery of his life? This couldn't be. Something had to be done immediately... though he didn't know what it was...
es_translation: Do you want to expose it? —exclaimed Dorian Gray, feeling a strange terror engulf him. Was the world going to witness his secret? Would people be left gaping at the mystery of his life? Impossible. Something had to be done, he didn't know what yet, and it had to be done immediately.

en: “Yes; I don’t suppose you will object to that. Georges Petit is going to collect all my best pictures for a special exhibition in the Rue de Sèze, which will open the first week in October. The portrait will only be away a month. I should think you could easily spare it for that time. In fact, you are sure to be out of town. And if you keep it always behind a screen, you can’t care much about it.”
vi: “Vâng; tôi không nghĩ là anh sẽ phản đối việc ấy. George Petit sắp thu thập mọi bức tranh đẹp nhất của tôi cho một triển lãm đặc biệt ở Rue de Sèze, sẽ khai mạc vào tuần đầu tháng Mười. Bức chân dung sẽ chỉ phải đi xa một tháng. Tôi cho là cậu có thể dễ dàng nhường nó lại trong thời gian ấy. Trên thực tế, cậu chắc chắn sẽ ra ngoài thành phố. Và nếu cậu luôn giữ nó sau một tấm chắn thì cậu cũng không thể quan tâm lắm đến nó.”
tr: “Evet. Buna karşı çıkacağını sanmıyorum. George Petit4 en iyi resimlerimi toparlayıp Sèze Sokağı’nda özel bir sergi açacak, ekimin ilk haftasında. Portreden topu topu bir ay uzak kalacaksın. Sanırım buna kolaylıkla katlanabilirsin. Hatta Londra’dan uzakta bile olabilirsin o sırada. Zaten hep paravan ardında tutuyorsan pek beğenmiyorsun demektir.
es: —Sí; espero que no te opongas. George Petit va a reunir mis mejores obras para una exposición personal en la rue de Séze que se inaugurará la primera semana de octubre. El retrato sólo estará fuera un mes. Creo que podrás pasarte sin él ese tiempo. De hecho es seguro que no estarás en Londres. Y si lo tienes detrás de un biombo, quiere decir que no te importa demasiado.
vi_translation: "Yes; I don't think you will object to that." "George Petit is about to gather all my finest paintings for a special exhibition at Rue de Sèze, which will open in the first week of October. The portrait will only have to be away for a month." "I suppose you can easily part with it during that time." "In fact, you will certainly be out of town." "And if you always keep it behind a screen, you can't be too concerned about it."
tr_translation: “Yes. I don't think you'll object to this. George Petit4 will gather my best paintings and open a private exhibition on Sèze Street, in the first week of October. You will be away from the portrait for only a month. I think you can easily endure this. In fact, you might even be away from London at that time. If you always keep it behind a screen, it means you don't like it very much anyway.”
es_translation: —Yes; I hope you don't mind. George Petit is going to gather my best works for a personal exhibition on rue de Séze that will open the first week of October. The portrait will only be away for a month. I think you can do without it for that time. In fact, it's certain that you won't be in London. And if you have it behind a screen, it means you don't care too much about it.

en: “Why, what did you expect, Dorian? You didn’t see anything else in the picture, did you? There was nothing else to see?”
vi: “Là sao, cậu mong đợi gì, Dorian? Cậu không thấy gì khác trên bức tranh, phải không? Không có gì khác để thấy sao?”
tr: “Nasıl? Sen ne bekliyordun ki Dorian? Portrede daha başka bir şeyler mi gördün yoksa? Ama görülecek başka bir şey yoktu ki. Öyle değil mi?
es: —¿Qué esperabas, Dorian? No has visto ninguna otra cosa en el cuadro, ¿no es cierto? ¿Había algo más que ver?
vi_translation: “What do you mean, what are you expecting, Dorian? You don't see anything different in the painting, do you? Is there nothing else to see?”
tr_translation: "How? What were you expecting, Dorian? Did you see something else in the portrait? But there was nothing else to see. Isn't that right?"
es_translation: —What did you expect, Dorian? You haven't seen anything else in the picture, have you? Was there anything else to see?

en: “Pleasanter for you, I am afraid,” murmured Hallward regretfully. “And now good-bye. I am sorry you won’t let me look at the picture once again. But that can’t be helped. I quite understand what you feel about it.”
vi: “Vui hơn với cậu, tôi e là vậy,” Hallward lẩm bẩm, tiếc nuối. “Giờ thì tạm biệt. Tôi rất lấy làm tiếc là cậu không cho tôi nhìn bức tranh một lần nữa. Nhưng biết làm sao. Tôi thấu hiểu những gì cậu cảm thấy ở nó.”
tr: Hallward üzgün üzgün, “Korkarım yalnızca senin için öyle olur,” diye mırıldandı. “Şimdi artık, hoşça kal. Şu resme bir kerecik daha bakmama izin vermediğin için üzgünüm, ama elden ne gelir? Senin bu konudaki duygularını çok iyi anlıyorum.
es: —Placentero para ti, mucho me temo —murmuró Hallward, pesaroso—. Y ahora, adiós. Siento que no me dejes ver el cuadro una vez más. Pero qué se le va a hacer. Entiendo perfectamente tus sentimientos.
vi_translation: “Happier for you, I fear so,” Hallward muttered, regretfully. “Now, goodbye. I am very sorry that you won't let me see the painting one more time. But what can be done. I understand how you feel about it.”
tr_translation: Hallward said sadly, "I'm afraid it would only be that way for you," he murmured. "Now, goodbye. I'm sorry you didn't let me look at the painting one more time, but what can be done? I understand your feelings on this matter very well."
es_translation: —Pleasant for you, I very much fear —murmured Hallward, sorrowful—. And now, goodbye. I regret that you won't let me see the painting once more. But what can be done. I completely understand your feelings.

en: As the door closed, Dorian put the key in his pocket and looked round the room. His eye fell on a large, purple satin coverlet heavily embroidered with gold, a splendid piece of late seventeenth-century Venetian work that his grandfather had found in a convent near Bologna. Yes, that would serve to wrap the dreadful thing in. It had perhaps served often as a pall for the dead. Now it was to hide something that had a corruption of its own, worse than the corruption of death itself—something that would breed horrors and yet would never die. What the worm was to the corpse, his sins would be to the painted image on the canvas. They would mar its beauty and eat away its grace. They would defile it and make it shameful. And yet the thing would still live on. It would be always alive.
vi: Lúc cửa đóng, Dorian nhét chìa khóa vào túi, nhìn quanh phòng. Mắt cậu để ý thấy một cái khăn phủ giường lớn bằng xa-tanh tía, thêu đặc vàng, một tác phẩm lộng lẫy của Venice thời cuối thế kỷ mười bảy mà ông ngoại cậu đã tìm thấy trong một nữ tu viện gần Bologna. Đúng, nó sẽ được dùng để bọc cái thứ khủng khiếp ấy lại. Nó không chừng từng được dùng thường xuyên như một tấm vải phủ áo quan cho người chết. Giờ thì nó che giấu một thứ gì đó có sự mục nát riêng, còn tệ hơn cả sự mục nát của bản thân cái chết — một thứ gì đó sẽ sản sinh ra các nỗi sợ song lại không bao giờ chết. Những gì mà sâu bọ làm với xác chết, cũng là những cái mà các tội lỗi của cậu sẽ làm với hình ảnh được vẽ trên tấm toan. Chúng sẽ phá vẻ đẹp của nó, ăn mất nét duyên của nó. Chúng sẽ làm ô uế nó, khiến nó xấu hổ. Tuy nhiên thứ ấy sẽ vẫn sống tiếp. Nó sẽ sống mãi.
tr: Kapı kapanınca Dorian anahtarı cebine atarak dört bir yanına bakındı. Ağır sırma işlemeli, geniş, mor satenden bir örtü gözüne ilişti. On yedinci yüzyılın sonlarından kalma şahane bir Venedik işlemesi olan bu örtüyü dedesi Bologna dolaylarındaki bir manastırda bulmuştu. Evet, o ürkünç şeyin üstüne örtmeye uygundu. Belki de genellikle cenaze üstüne örtülmek için kullanılmıştı. Şimdi de içinde kendince bir çürümeyi taşıyan bir şeyi gizlemeye yarayacaktı; ölüm çürümesinden daha beter bir çürümeyi taşıyan, durmadan ürküler doğurduğu halde bir türlü ölmeyen bir şey. Solucan ve kurtlar yerdeki ölü için neyse, Dorian’ın günahları da tuval üstündeki boyalı imge için aynı şey olacaktı. Günahlar bu imgenin güzelliğini bozacak, inceliğini kemirecekti. Kirleteceklerdi bu imgeyi, edepsiz bir şeye dönüştüreceklerdi. Ama portre hâlâ yaşamını sürdürecekti. Her zaman canlı kalacaktı.
es: Al cerrarse la puerta, Dorian se guardó la llave en el bolsillo y recorrió la biblioteca con la mirada. Sus ojos se detuvieron en un amplio cubrecama de satén morado con bordados en oro que su abuelo había encontrado en un convento próximo a Bolonia. Sí; serviría para envolver el horrible lienzo. Quizás se había utilizado más de una vez como mortaja. Ahora tendría que ocultar algo con una corrupción peculiar, peor que la de los muertos: algo que engendraría horrores sin por ello morir nunca. Lo que los gusanos eran para el cadáver, serían sus pecados para la imagen pintada en el lienzo, destruyendo su apostura y devorando su gracia. Lo mancharían, convirtiéndolo en algo vergonzoso. Y sin embargo aquella cosa seguiría viva, viviría siempre.
vi_translation: When the door closed, Dorian put the key in his pocket and looked around the room. His eyes noticed a large satin bedspread, richly embroidered in gold, a splendid work from late seventeenth-century Venice that his grandfather had found in a nunnery near Bologna. Yes, it would be used to wrap that horrible thing. It might have once been frequently used as a shroud for the dead. Now it concealed something with its own decay, worse than the decay of death itself — something that would produce fears but never die. What worms do to a corpse, so would his sins do to the image painted on the canvas. They would mar its beauty, consume its grace. They would defile it, make it shameful. Yet it would continue to live. It would live on forever.
tr_translation: When the door closed, Dorian put the key in his pocket and looked around. A heavy, gold-embroidered, wide, purple satin cover caught his eye. This cover, a magnificent Venetian embroidery from the late seventeenth century, had been found by his grandfather in a monastery near Bologna. Yes, it was suitable to cover that dreadful thing. Perhaps it had generally been used to cover a corpse. Now it would serve to hide something that carried its own kind of decay; something that carried a decay worse than death's decay, something that continually spawned horrors yet never died. What worms and maggots are to a corpse in the ground, Dorian's sins would be to the painted image on the canvas. Sins would mar this image's beauty, gnaw at its delicacy. They would defile this image, turn it into something obscene. But the portrait would still continue to live. It would always remain alive.
es_translation: As the door closed, Dorian put the key in his pocket and scanned the library with his eyes. His eyes stopped on a large purple satin bedspread with gold embroidery that his grandfather had found in a convent near Bologna. Yes; it would serve to wrap the horrible canvas. Perhaps it had been used more than once as a shroud. Now it would have to hide something with a peculiar corruption, worse than that of the dead: something that would spawn horrors without ever dying. What worms were to the corpse, his sins would be to the image painted on the canvas, destroying its comeliness and devouring its grace. They would stain it, turning it into something shameful. And yet that thing would remain alive, it would live forever.

en: “I am so sorry you have given yourself the trouble of coming round, Mr. Hubbard. I shall certainly drop in and look at the frame—though I don’t go in much at present for religious art—but to-day I only want a picture carried to the top of the house for me. It is rather heavy, so I thought I would ask you to lend me a couple of your men.”
vi: “Tôi rất lấy làm tiếc là ông đã phải mất công đích thân đến đây, mít-tơ Hubbard. Tôi nhất định sẽ tạt qua xem cái khung — mặc dù hiện tại thì tôi không ưa chuộng nghệ thuật tôn giáo cho lắm — nhưng hôm nay tôi chỉ cần đưa giúp tôi một bức tranh lên tầng thượng ngôi nhà. Nó khá nặng, nên tôi nghĩ tôi phải phiền ông cho mượn vài người thợ của ông.”
tr: “Sizi buraya gelmek zahmetine soktuğum için üzgünüm, mr Hubbard. Gerçi dinsel resimlere pek merakım yoktur, ama mutlaka gelip çerçevenize bakarım. Bugün istediğimse, evin üst katına bir resim taşıtmaktan ibaret. Oldukça ağır bir şey; bu yüzden sizden iki yardımcı istemeyi düşündüm.
es: —Siento mucho que se haya tomado tantas molestias, señor Hubbard. Iré desde luego a su establecimiento para ver el marco, aunque últimamente no me interesa demasiado la pintura religiosa, pero en el día de hoy sólo se trata de subir un cuadro a lo más alto de la casa. Pesa bastante, y por eso he pensado en pedirle que me prestara a un par de hombres.
vi_translation: “I am very sorry that you had to come here in person, Mr. Hubbard. I will definitely drop by to see the frame — although currently, I am not very fond of religious art — but today I just need you to help me bring a painting up to the rooftop of the house. It is quite heavy, so I think I will need to borrow a few of your workers.”
tr_translation: “I am sorry for putting you through the trouble of coming here, Mr. Hubbard. Although I am not very interested in religious paintings, I will definitely come and look at your frame. What I want today is simply to have a painting carried to the upper floor of the house. It is quite a heavy thing; that's why I thought of asking you for two helpers.”
es_translation: —I'm very sorry that you went to so much trouble, Mr. Hubbard. I will certainly go to your establishment to see the frame, although lately, religious painting doesn't interest me much, but today it's just about getting a painting to the top of the house. It's quite heavy, and that's why I thought of asking you to lend me a couple of men.

en: “This,” replied Dorian, moving the screen back. “Can you move it, covering and all, just as it is? I don’t want it to get scratched going upstairs.”
vi: “Cái này,” Dorian trả lời, dịch tấm chắn lại. “Ông có thể chuyển nó mà vẫn phủ nguyên mọi cái như thế không? Tôi không muốn nó bị xước khi lên gác.”
tr: Dorian, “Bu,” diyerek paravanayı çekti. “Böyle örtüsüyle falan taşıyabilecek misiniz bunu? Yukarı çıkarken çizilmesini istemiyorum da.
es: —Ésta —replicó Dorian Gray, apartando el biombo—. ¿Podrá usted moverlo, con la tela que lo cubre, tal como está? No quiero que se roce por las escaleras.
vi_translation: “This one,” Dorian replied, shifting the shield. “Can you move it while still covering everything like this? I don't want it to get scratched when we take it upstairs.”
tr_translation: Dorian said, "Here," and pulled the screen. "Will you be able to carry this with its cover and all? I don't want it to get scratched while going upstairs."
es_translation: —This one —replied Dorian Gray, moving the screen aside—. Can you move it, with the cloth covering it, just as it is? I don't want it to get scratched on the stairs.

en: “I will show you the way, Mr. Hubbard, if you will kindly follow me. Or perhaps you had better go in front. I am afraid it is right at the top of the house. We will go up by the front staircase, as it is wider.”
