en: “I like him,” said Lord Henry. “A great many people don’t, but I find him charming. He atones for being occasionally somewhat overdressed by being always absolutely over-educated. He is a very modern type.”
vi: “Tôi thích y,” huân tước Henry nói. “Rất nhiều người không thích, nhưng tôi thấy y quyến rũ. Y chuộc cái lỗi thỉnh thoảng ăn diện hơi quá đà bằng cách luôn có học vấn quá cao. Y là một mẫu người rất hiện đại.”
tr: “Hoşlanıyorum ondan,” dedi Lord Henry. “Birçokları sevmez, ama bana pek sevimli geliyor. Ara sıra biraz aşırı giyimli olmanın kusurunu, her zaman aşırı kültürlü olmasıyla kapatıyor. Çok çağdaş bir tip.
es: —Me gusta —dijo lord Henry—. Hay mucha gente que no está de acuerdo, pero yo lo encuentro encantador. Compensa sus ocasionales excesos en el vestir con una educación siempre ultrarrefinada. Es una persona muy moderna.
vi_translation: "I like him," Lord Henry said. "Many people don't, but I find him charming. He compensates for the occasional overdressing by always being highly educated. He is a very modern type of person."
tr_translation: “I like him,” said Lord Henry. “Many do not, but I find him quite charming. He makes up for the occasional fault of being overdressed by always being overly cultured. A very contemporary type.”
es_translation: —I like him —said Lord Henry—. There are many people who disagree, but I find him charming. He compensates for his occasional excesses in dressing with an always ultra-refined education. He is a very modern person.

en: “Ah! what a nuisance people’s people are! Try and make him come. By the way, Dorian, you ran off very early last night. You left before eleven. What did you do afterwards? Did you go straight home?”
vi: “Ôi! Những người của công chúng mới phiền toái làm sao! Cố mời y đến đi. Nhân thể, Dorian, đêm qua cậu bỏ về quá sớm. Cậu về trước mười một giờ. Sau đó cậu làm gì? Cậu có về thẳng nhà không?”
tr: “Öf, dostların aileleri de amma baş belası ha! Zorla da gelsin, Dorian. Ha, dün gece çok erken kaçtın. On birden önce kalkıverdin. Sonradan ne yaptın ki? Dosdoğru eve mi döndün?
es: —¡Ah! ¡Qué molestas son las familias! Procura que vaya. Por cierto, Dorian, anoche desapareciste muy pronto. ¿Qué hiciste después? ¿Volver directamente a casa?
vi_translation: “Oh! How troublesome public figures are! Try to invite him over. By the way, Dorian, you left too early last night. You left before eleven o'clock. What did you do after that? Did you go straight home?”
tr_translation: “Ugh, friends' families are such a headache, huh! Come on, Dorian, come by force if you must. Hey, you left very early last night. You got up before eleven. What did you do afterwards? Did you go straight home?”
es_translation: —Ah! How annoying families are! Make sure she goes. By the way, Dorian, you disappeared very early last night. What did you do afterwards? Go straight home?

en: It is said that passion makes one think in a circle. Certainly with hideous iteration the bitten lips of Dorian Gray shaped and reshaped those subtle words that dealt with soul and sense, till he had found in them the full expression, as it were, of his mood, and justified, by intellectual approval, passions that without such justification would still have dominated his temper. From cell to cell of his brain crept the one thought; and the wild desire to live, most terrible of all man’s appetites, quickened into force each trembling nerve and fibre. Ugliness that had once been hateful to him because it made things real, became dear to him now for that very reason. Ugliness was the one reality. The coarse brawl, the loathsome den, the crude violence of disordered life, the very vileness of thief and outcast, were more vivid, in their intense actuality of impression, than all the gracious shapes of art, the dreamy shadows of song. They were what he needed for forgetfulness. In three days he would be free.
vi: Nghe đồn là sự đam mê làm cho con người nghĩ ngợi loanh quanh. Đúng là với sự lặp đi lặp lại chán ngắt, đôi môi mím chặt của Dorian Gray cứ nhào đi nặn lại những lời quỷ quyệt bàn về linh hồn và cảm xúc ấy, cho đến khi cậu thấy trong nó toàn bộ biểu hiện, có thể nói là, của tâm trạng cậu, và biện hộ được, bằng sự chấp thuận của trí thông minh, cho những đam mê mà nếu không có sự biện hộ như vậy thì sẽ vẫn còn chi phối tâm trạng cậu. Từ tế bào não này qua tế bào não khác, một ý nghĩ lẻn qua; và nỗi khát khao dữ dội với sự sống, nỗi khát khao ghê gớm nhất trong số mọi ham muốn của con người, đã hồi sinh mạnh mẽ từng sợi thần kinh và mỗi thớ thịt run rẩy. Sự xấu xí mà có lần cậu thấy đáng ghét vì nó làm cho các thứ trở về thực tế thì lúc này lại trở nên thân thương với cậu cũng vì chính lý do đó. Sự xấu xí là thực tại độc nhất. Tiếng cãi cọ tục tĩu, cái ổ ghê tởm, bạo lực thô thiển của cuộc sống bừa bãi, và chính sự hèn hạ của bọn trộm cắp bụi đời, lại còn sinh động, nhờ ấn tượng hiện thực mãnh liệt của chúng, hơn mọi loại hình Nghệ thuật tử tế, những cái bóng mơ màng của Thơ ca. Chúng là những gì cậu cần để lãng quên. Cậu sẽ tự do trong ba ngày.
tr: Derler ki tutku kişinin düşüncelerini çember gibi çevirip gene başladığı noktaya getirirmiş. Gerçekten de Dorian kemirip durduğu dudaklarıyla, ruh ve duyu konusundaki o anlamlı sözleri iğrenç bir zikir gibi yineleyip duruyordu. Öyle ki en sonunda bu sözlerde ruhsal durumunun tam açıklamasını bulmaya başladı ve böylece tutkularını zihninin onayıyla haklı çıkardı. Ama bu onay olmasa da bu tutkular onun benliğinden ellerini çekmeyeceklerdi, nasılsa. Bu bir tek düşünce, onun beynindeki bir hücreden ötekine süzülüyor ve çılgın yaşama arzusu, insanoğlunun bu en ürkünç iştahı, titreyen sinir ve liflerinin her birine özsuyu gibi yürüyerek güç veriyordu. Bir zamanlar, her şeye gerçeklik kattığı için nefret ettiği çirkinliği şimdi aynı nedenle kendine yakın buluyordu. Tek gerçek çirkinlikti. Adi kavgalar, iğrenç izbeler, başıboş yaşantıların haşin şiddeti, hırsızların, itin, uğursuzun pespayeliği, çirkinliğin ürünleri, yarattıkları izlenimlerin elle tutulur yoğunluğu yüzünden sanatın girdiği bütün güzel biçimlerden, şarkının söylediği bütün düşsel gölgelerden daha canlı, daha belirgindi. Dorian’ın unutabilmek için gereksindiği şeyler işte bunlardı. Üç gün içinde özgürlüğüne kavuşacaktı.
es: Se dice que la pasión hace que se piense en círculos. Y, ciertamente, los labios que Dorian Gray no cesaba de morderse formaban y volvían a formar, en espantosa repetición, las sutiles palabras que se ocupaban del alma y de los sentidos, hasta encontrar en ellas la plena expresión, por así decirlo, de su estado de ánimo, y justificar así, aprobándolas intelectualmente, pasiones que sin esa justificación habrían dominado su voluntad. De célula en célula aquella idea única se apoderaba de su cerebro; y el arrebatado deseo de vivir, el más terrible de los apetitos humanos, redoblaba el vigor de cada nervio y músculo temblorosos. La fealdad que en otro tiempo le había parecido odiosa porque hacía las cosas reales, le resultaba ahora amable por esa misma razón. La fealdad era la única realidad. La trifulca vulgar, el antro repugnante, la violencia brutal de una vida desordenada, la vileza misma del ladrón y del fuera de la ley, tenían más vida, creaban una impresión de realidad más intensa que todas las elegantes formas del Arte, que las sombras soñadoras de la Canción. Eran lo que necesitaba para alcanzar el olvido. En el espacio de tres días quedaría libre.
vi_translation: It is rumored that passion makes people think in circles. Indeed, with the monotonous repetition, Dorian Gray's tightly pressed lips kept molding and reshaping those wicked words about the soul and emotions, until he saw in them the full expression, so to speak, of his mood, and justified, with the approval of intelligence, the passions that without such justification would still dominate his mood. From one brain cell to another, a thought sneaked through; and the intense craving for life, the most terrible of all human desires, revived powerfully every nerve and each trembling muscle fiber. The ugliness that he once found repulsive because it brought things back to reality now became dear to him for that very reason. Ugliness was the only reality. The obscene quarrels, the disgusting den, the crude violence of a disordered life, and even the baseness of the street thieves, were more vivid, thanks to their intense impression of reality, than any form of decent Art, the dreamy shadows of Poetry. They were what he needed to forget. He would be free in three days.
tr_translation: They say that passion circles a person's thoughts like a ring and brings them back to where they started. Indeed, Dorian, with his gnawed lips, kept repeating those meaningful words about soul and sense like a disgusting chant. So much so that in the end, he began to find a complete explanation of his spiritual state in these words and thus justified his passions with the approval of his mind. But even without this approval, these passions would not withdraw their hands from his being, anyway. This single thought was seeping from one cell in his brain to another, and the mad desire to live, this most dreadful appetite of mankind, was giving strength to every trembling nerve and fiber like sap. Once, he hated ugliness because it added reality to everything, but now he found it close to himself for the same reason. The only reality was ugliness. Vulgar brawls, disgusting slums, the harsh violence of vagrant lives, the baseness of thieves, dogs, and scoundrels, the products of ugliness, were more vivid and distinct than all the beautiful forms that art entered, and all the imaginary shadows that song sang, because of the tangible intensity of the impressions they created. These were the things Dorian needed to forget. In three days, he would be free.
es_translation: It is said that passion makes one think in circles. And, certainly, the lips that Dorian Gray kept biting formed and reformed, in a dreadful repetition, the subtle words that dealt with the soul and the senses, until he found in them the full expression, so to speak, of his state of mind, and thus justified, by intellectually approving them, passions that without that justification would have dominated his will. From cell to cell that single idea took hold of his brain; and the frantic desire to live, the most terrible of human appetites, redoubled the vigor of every trembling nerve and muscle. The ugliness that had once seemed odious to him because it made things real, now seemed kind to him for that very reason. Ugliness was the only reality. The vulgar brawl, the repugnant den, the brutal violence of a disordered life, the very vileness of the thief and the outlaw, had more life, created a more intense impression of reality than all the elegant forms of Art, than the dreamy shadows of Song. They were what he needed to achieve oblivion. In the span of three days, he would be free.

en: At the end of the room there was a little staircase, leading to a darkened chamber. As Dorian hurried up its three rickety steps, the heavy odour of opium met him. He heaved a deep breath, and his nostrils quivered with pleasure. When he entered, a young man with smooth yellow hair, who was bending over a lamp lighting a long thin pipe, looked up at him and nodded in a hesitating manner.
vi: Ở cuối phòng có một cầu thang nhỏ, dẫn lên một căn buồng tối sầm. Lúc Dorian vội vã leo lên ba bậc thang ọp ẹp, mùi thuốc phiện nồng nặc đón cậu. Cậu hít một hơi thật sâu, mũi cậu run rẩy vì sướng. Khi cậu vào rồi, một thanh niên tóc vàng mượt, đang khom lưng trên một cái đèn và châm cái tẩu dài nhỏ, nhìn cậu, gật đầu chào với thái độ do dự.
tr: Odanın dibindeki alçak bir merdiven karanlık bir bölmeye çıkıyordu. Dorian merdivenin sallantılı üç basamağını koşarak çıkarken afyonun ağır kokusu onu karşıladı. Dorian derin derin soludu, burun delikleri hazla titreşiyordu. O içeri girdiği zaman, bir lambanın üzerine eğilmiş elindeki ince uzun çubuğu yakmakta olan düz, sarı saçlı bir genç adam başını kaldırıp ona baktı, sonra, biraz kararsızlıkla selam verdi.
es: Al fondo de la habitación, una escalerita conducía a una habitación oscura. Mientras Dorian se apresuraba a ascender los tres desvencijados escalones, el denso olor del opio le asaltó. Respiró hondo y las aletas de la nariz se le estremecieron de placer. Al entrar, un joven de lisos cabellos rubios que, inclinado sobre una lámpara, encendía una larga pipa muy fina, miró en su dirección y le saludó, titubeante, con una inclinación de cabeza.
vi_translation: At the end of the room, there was a small staircase leading up to a darkened chamber. As Dorian hurriedly climbed the three creaky steps, the strong smell of opium greeted him. He took a deep breath, his nose trembling with pleasure. When he entered, a young man with sleek blonde hair, bent over a lamp and lighting a small long pipe, looked at him and nodded in greeting with a hesitant attitude.
tr_translation: A low staircase at the back of the room led to a dark compartment. As Dorian ran up the shaky three steps of the staircase, the heavy scent of opium greeted him. Dorian took a deep breath, his nostrils quivering with pleasure. When he entered, a young man with straight, blond hair, who was leaning over a lamp lighting a long, thin pipe in his hand, looked up at him and then greeted him with a bit of hesitation.
es_translation: At the back of the room, a small staircase led to a dark room. As Dorian hurried to ascend the three rickety steps, the dense smell of opium assaulted him. He took a deep breath, and his nostrils quivered with pleasure. Upon entering, a young man with smooth blond hair, who was leaning over a lamp lighting a long, very thin pipe, looked in his direction and greeted him hesitantly with a nod.

en: “It’s no use,” sighed Adrian Singleton. “I don’t care to go back. What does it matter? I am quite happy here.”
vi: “Chẳng ích gì đâu,” Adrian Singleton thở dài. “Tôi không thích quay lại. Quan trọng gì? Ở đây tôi thấy rất vui.
tr: Adrian, “Boşuna,” diye içini çekti. “Dönmek istemiyorum. Ne fark eder? Burada bal gibi mutluyum ben.
es: —Es inútil —suspiró Adrian Singleton—. No tengo ganas de volver. ¿Qué más da? Estoy muy bien aquí.
vi_translation: "It's no use," Adrian Singleton sighed. "I don't want to go back. What's the point? I'm very happy here."
tr_translation: Adrian sighed, "It's pointless." "I don't want to go back. What difference does it make? I'm perfectly happy here."
es_translation: —It's useless —sighed Adrian Singleton—. I don't feel like going back. What difference does it make? I'm very well here.

en: “You will write to me if you want anything, won’t you?” said Dorian, after a pause.
vi: “Anh sẽ biên cho tôi nếu anh cần bất cứ thứ gì nhé, hứa đi?” Dorian nói, sau một lúc ngừng.
tr: Bir duralamadan sonra Dorian, “Bir şeye ihtiyacın olursa bana yazarsın, değil mi?” diye sordu.
es: —Me escribirás si necesitas algo, ¿de acuerdo? —dijo Dorian después de una pausa.
vi_translation: “You will write to me if you need anything, promise?” Dorian said, after a moment's pause.
tr_translation: After a pause, Dorian asked, "If you need anything, you'll write to me, won't you?"
es_translation: —You will write to me if you need anything, alright? —said Dorian after a pause.

en: Dorian walked to the door with a look of pain in his face. As he drew the curtain aside, a hideous laugh broke from the painted lips of the woman who had taken his money. “There goes the devil’s bargain!” she hiccoughed, in a hoarse voice.
vi: Dorian bước đến cửa với vẻ đau đớn trên mặt. Lúc cậu kéo rèm qua bên thì một tiếng cười khả ố bật ra khỏi đôi môi tô son của người đàn bà vừa lấy tiền của cậu. “Mới diễn ra một giao kèo của quỷ!” mụ vừa nói vừa nấc, bằng giọng khàn đặc.
tr: Dorian yüzünde acı çektiğini belli eden bir ifadeyle kapıya doğru yürüdü. Perdeyi araladığı sırada biraz önce parasını almış olan kadının o boyalı dudaklarından çirkin bir kahkaha koptu. Kadın taraz taraz bir sesle, hıçkırık tutmuş gibi, “İşte, şeytanın satın aldığı adam!” diye konuştu.
es: Dorian se dirigió hacia la puerta con una expresión dolorida en el rostro. Cuando apartaba la cortina verde, una risa espantosa salió de los labios pintados de la mujer que había recogido las monedas. —¡Ahí va el protegido del diablo! —exclamó con voz ronca entre dos ataques de hipo.
vi_translation: Dorian walked to the door with a look of pain on his face. As he pulled the curtain aside, a hideous laugh burst from the painted lips of the woman who had just taken his money. "A devil's bargain has just been struck!" she said with a thick, hoarse voice, hiccuping.
tr_translation: Dorian walked towards the door with an expression on his face that showed he was in pain. As he drew the curtain aside, an ugly laugh burst from the painted lips of the woman who had just taken his money. In a raspy voice, as if caught by a sob, the woman said, "There goes the man bought by the devil!"
es_translation: Dorian walked towards the door with a pained expression on his face. As he drew aside the green curtain, a ghastly laugh escaped the painted lips of the woman who had collected the coins. —There goes the devil's protégé! —he exclaimed in a hoarse voice between two hiccups.

en: Callous, concentrated on evil, with stained mind, and soul hungry for rebellion, Dorian Gray hastened on, quickening his step as he went, but as he darted aside into a dim archway, that had served him often as a short cut to the ill-famed place where he was going, he felt himself suddenly seized from behind, and before he had time to defend himself, he was thrust back against the wall, with a brutal hand round his throat.
vi: Chai sạn, tập trung vào cái ác, với tâm hồn vẩn đục và linh hồn khát khao nổi loạn, Dorian Gray đi gấp, rảo bước nhanh hơn, nhưng khi cậu lao qua bên, vào con đường tối mò dưới cái mái vòm vẫn hay phụng sự cậu như lối tắt tới cái nơi khét tiếng mà cậu đang đến, cậu chợt cảm thấy mình bị tóm lấy từ phía sau, và trước khi cậu có thời gian để tự vệ thì cậu đã bị xô vào tường, với một bàn tay hung ác vòng quanh cổ cậu.
tr: Günah düşüncelerine saplanmaktan yüreği taşlaşmış, zihni kararmış, ruhu isyana acıkmış durumdaki Dorian Gray adımlarını gitgide sıklaştırarak son hızla yürümeyi sürdürüyordu. Derken, gittiği kötü yere kestirmeden ulaşmak için çoğunlukla yaptığı gibi loş bir kemer altına saptığı sırada birinin onu apansız arkadan kavradığını hissetti. Daha kendini savunmaya fırsat bulamadan duvara doğru itildi, acımasız bir el boğazına yapıştı.
es: Insensible, sin otra meta que el mal, contaminado el espíritu y el alma hambrienta de rebeldía, Dorian Gray se apresuró, acelerando el paso a medida que avanzaba. Pero en el momento en que se desviaba con el fin de penetrar por un pasaje oscuro que con frecuencia le había servido de atajo para llegar al lugar adonde se dirigía, sintió que lo sujetaban por detrás y, antes de que tuviera tiempo para defenderse, se vio arrojado contra el muro, con una mano brutal apretándole la garganta.
vi_translation: Hardened, focused on evil, with a tainted soul and a spirit yearning for rebellion, Dorian Gray hurried, quickening his pace, but as he dashed aside, into the pitch-dark road under the archway that often served him as a shortcut to the infamous place he was heading to, he suddenly felt himself grabbed from behind, and before he had time to defend himself, he was shoved against the wall, with a vicious hand wrapped around his neck.
tr_translation: With his heart hardened from being mired in sinful thoughts, his mind darkened, and his soul hungry for rebellion, Dorian Gray continued to walk at full speed, quickening his steps more and more. Then, as he turned into a dim archway, as he often did to take a shortcut to the bad place he was heading, he felt someone suddenly grab him from behind. Before he had a chance to defend himself, he was pushed against the wall, a ruthless hand gripping his throat.
es_translation: Insensible, with no other goal than evil, his spirit contaminated and his soul hungry for rebellion, Dorian Gray hurried, quickening his pace as he went. But at the moment he turned to enter a dark passage that had often served as a shortcut to his destination, he felt himself grabbed from behind, and before he had time to defend himself, he was thrown against the wall, with a brutal hand squeezing his throat.

en: Dorian Gray grew sick with fear. “I never knew her,” he stammered. “I never heard of her. You are mad.”
vi: Dorian sợ phát ốm. “Tôi chưa hề quen cô ấy,” cậu lắp bắp. “Tôi chưa hề nghe về cô ấy. Anh điên rồi.”
tr: Dorian Gray korkudan bayılacak gibi oldu. “Onu tanımıyorum,” diye kekeledi. “Adını bile duymuş değilim. Sen delisin.
es: Dorian Gray se sintió enfermar de miedo. —No sé de qué me habla —tartamudeó—. Nunca he oído ese nombre. Está usted loco.
vi_translation: Dorian was scared to death. “I have never met her,” he stammered. “I have never heard of her. You are crazy.”
tr_translation: Dorian Gray felt like he was going to faint from fear. “I don't know him,” he stammered. “I haven't even heard his name. You are mad.”
es_translation: Dorian Gray felt sick with fear. —I don't know what you're talking about —he stammered—. I've never heard that name. You're crazy.

en: “Eighteen years,” laughed Dorian Gray, with a touch of triumph in his voice. “Eighteen years! Set me under the lamp and look at my face!”
vi: “Mười tám năm,” Dorian Gray cười lớn, với một chút vui mừng trong giọng. “Mười tám năm! Hãy đưa tôi ra dưới ánh đèn và nhìn mặt tôi!”
tr: Dorian Gray, “On sekiz yıl ha!” diye güldü. Sesinde bir zafer tınısı vardı. “On sekiz yıl! Beni şu fenerin dibine götür de yüzüme bak!
es: —Dieciocho años —rió Dorian Gray, con acento triunfal en la voz—. ¡Dieciocho años! ¡Lléveme bajo la luz y míreme la cara!
vi_translation: "Eighteen years," Dorian Gray laughed loudly, with a hint of joy in his voice. "Eighteen years! Bring me under the light and look at my face!"
tr_translation: Dorian Gray laughed, "Eighteen years, huh!" There was a tone of triumph in his voice. "Eighteen years! Take me to the base of that lantern and look at my face!"
es_translation: —Eighteen years —laughed Dorian Gray, with a triumphant tone in his voice—. Eighteen years! Take me under the light and look at my face!

en: Dorian Gray drew a long breath. “You have been on the brink of committing a terrible crime, my man,” he said, looking at him sternly. “Let this be a warning to you not to take vengeance into your own hands.”
vi: Dorian Gray hít một hơi thở dài. “Anh xém chút nữa là phạm phải một tội ác khủng khiếp, người ơi,” cậu nói, nhìn y nghiêm khắc. “Hãy để việc này là một lời răn cho anh rằng đừng có tự tay trả thù.”
tr: Dorian Gray derin bir soluk aldı. Karşısındaki adama sert sert bakarak, “Neredeyse korkunç bir suç işlemek üzereydin, ahbap,” dedi. “Bu sana ders olsun da öç almayı Tanrı’ya bırak.
es: Dorian Gray respiró hondamente. —Ha estado usted a punto de cometer una terrible equivocación —dijo, mirándolo con severidad—. Que le sirva de escarmiento para no tomarse la justicia por su mano.
vi_translation: Dorian Gray took a deep breath. "You almost committed a terrible crime, my friend," he said, looking at him sternly. "Let this be a lesson to you not to take revenge into your own hands."
tr_translation: Dorian Gray took a deep breath. Looking sternly at the man in front of him, he said, "You were about to commit an almost terrible crime, my friend." "Let this be a lesson to you and leave revenge to God."
es_translation: Dorian Gray breathed deeply. —You were about to make a terrible mistake —he said, looking at him sternly—. Let this be a lesson to you not to take justice into your own hands.

en: “Forgive me, sir,” muttered James Vane. “I was deceived. A chance word I heard in that damned den set me on the wrong track.”
vi: “Tha lỗi cho tôi, thưa ngài,” James Vane thì thào. “Tôi bị lừa. Một lời tình cờ mà tôi nghe thấy trong cái ổ khốn kiếp ấy đã khiến tôi lạc lối.”
tr: James Vane, “Bağışlayın beni, beyefendi,” diye mırıldandı. “Aldanmışım. O Tanrı’nın belası izbede kulağıma çalınan bir söz beni yanılttı.
es: —Perdóneme —murmuró el otro—. Estaba equivocado. Una palabra oída en ese maldito antro ha hecho que me confundiera.
vi_translation: “Forgive me, sir,” James Vane whispered. “I was deceived. A chance word I overheard in that wretched den led me astray.”
tr_translation: James Vane, "Forgive me, sir," he murmured. "I was mistaken. A word I overheard in that godforsaken dive misled me."
es_translation: —Forgive me —murmured the other—. I was mistaken. A word heard in that damned den made me confused.

en: “I won’t hear of it,” laughed Lord Henry, sinking into a chair. “From a label there is no escape! I refuse the title.”
vi: “Tôi sẽ không đồng ý đâu” huân tước Henry cười, hạ mình xuống ghế. “Cái nhãn đã dán là không trốn được! Tôi từ chối danh hiệu này.”
tr: Lord Henry, “Sakın ha!” diye gülerek bir koltuğa çöktü. “Kişiye damga vuruldu mu kurtuluş yoktur! Bu sanı geri çeviriyorum.
es: —De ninguna de las maneras —rió lord Henry, dejándose caer en una silla—. ¡No hay forma de escapar a una etiqueta! Rechazo ese título.
vi_translation: “I will not agree,” Lord Henry laughed, lowering himself into the chair. “Once the label is attached, it cannot be escaped! I refuse this title.”
tr_translation: Lord Henry, "Don't you dare!" he said, laughing as he sank into a chair. "Once a person is branded, there is no escape! I reject this notion."
es_translation: —By no means —laughed Lord Henry, dropping into a chair—. There is no way to escape a label! I reject that title.

en: “That is your error, Harry, believe me. You value beauty far too much.”
vi: “Đó là lỗi của anh, Harry, tin tôi đi. Anh đánh giá sắc đẹp quá cao đó.”
tr: “Senin yanlışın da bu, inan bana, Harry. Güzelliğe aşırı değer biçiyorsun.
es: —Ése es tu error, Harry, créeme. Valoras demasiado la belleza.
vi_translation: “It is your fault, Harry, believe me. You overestimate beauty too much.”
tr_translation: “That's your mistake too, believe me, Harry. You place too much value on beauty.”
es_translation: —That is your mistake, Harry, believe me. You value beauty too much.

en: “Ah! don’t remind me of that,” cried Dorian Gray.
vi: “Ôi! Đừng nhắc tôi về điều ấy,” Dorian Gray kêu lên.
tr: Dorian, “Ay, onu anımsatma bana!” diye bağırdı.
es: —¡Ah! No me lo recuerdes —exclamó Dorian Gray.
vi_translation: “Oh! Don't remind me of that,” Dorian Gray exclaimed.
tr_translation: Dorian shouted, "Oh, don't remind me of that!"
es_translation: —Ah! Don't remind me —exclaimed Dorian Gray.

en: “For the most trivial things, Mr. Gray, I assure you. Usually because I come in at ten minutes to nine and tell her that I must be dressed by half-past eight.”
vi: “Vì những chuyện hết sức vớ vẩn, mít-tơ Gray, tôi cam đoan với anh. Thường thì vì tôi đến vào lúc chín giờ kém mười và bảo nó là tôi phải được mặc đồ xong trước tám rưỡi.”
tr: “İnanın bana, en entipüften şeyler yüzünden, mr Gray. Saat dokuza on kala onu çağırıp da, saat sekiz buçukta giyinmiş, hazırlanmış olmam gerektiğini söylediğim zaman kırılıyor, çoğunlukla.
es: —Las cosas más triviales, señor Gray, se lo aseguro. De ordinario me presento a las nueve menos diez y le digo que debo estar vestida para las ocho y media.
vi_translation: "For the most trivial matters, Mr. Gray, I assure you. Usually because I arrive at ten to nine and tell him that I must be dressed by half past eight."
tr_translation: “Believe me, Mr. Gray, it's often over the most trivial things. When I call him at ten to nine and tell him that I should have been dressed and ready by half-past eight, he gets upset, most of the time.”
es_translation: —The most trivial things, Mr. Gray, I assure you. Usually, I show up at ten to nine and tell him that I must be dressed by half-past eight.

en: “It seems to me that we never do anything else,” murmured Dorian.
vi: “Tôi thấy dường như chúng tôi chẳng bao giờ làm gì khác chứ nhỉ,” Dorian thì thầm.
tr: “Sevmekten başka bir şey yapmayız, gibi geliyor bana,” diye Dorian mırıldandı.
es: —Yo diría que apenas hacemos otra cosa —murmuró Dorian.
vi_translation: “It seems like we never do anything else, do we?” Dorian whispered.
tr_translation: “It seems to me that we do nothing but love,” Dorian murmured.
es_translation: —I would say we hardly do anything else —murmured Dorian.

en: “Especially when one has been wounded by it,” answered Lord Henry.
vi: “Nhất là khi ta bị nó làm tổn thương,” huân tước Henry trả lời.
tr: Lord Henry, “Özellikle o zaman,” diye karşılık verdi.
es: —Sobre todo cuando uno ha quedado herido —respondió lord Henry.
vi_translation: “Especially when it has hurt us,” Lord Henry replied.
tr_translation: Lord Henry, "Especially then," he replied.
es_translation: —Especially when one has been hurt —responded Lord Henry.

en: “Let me get you some orchids, Duchess,” cried Dorian, starting to his feet and walking down the conservatory.
vi: “Hãy để tôi lấy cho cô vài bông lan, thưa nữ công tước,” Dorian la lên, nhỏm phắt dậy, và bước xuống nhà kính.
tr: Dorian, “Size birkaç orkide koparayım, düşes,” diyerek kalkıp uzaklaştı.
es: —Permítame traerle unas orquídeas, duquesa —exclamó Dorian, poniéndose en pie y alejándose hacia el fondo del invernadero.
vi_translation: "Let me get you some orchids, Duchess," Dorian exclaimed, jumping up, and heading down to the greenhouse.
tr_translation: Dorian said, "Let me pick a few orchids for you, Duchess," and got up and walked away.
es_translation: —Allow me to bring you some orchids, Duchess —exclaimed Dorian, standing up and moving towards the back of the greenhouse.

en: “Ah! you must suit your frock to his flowers, Gladys.”
vi: “À! Cô phải chọn váy hợp với hoa cậu ấy, Gladys.”
tr: “Sen elbisenin rengini onun verdiği çiçeklere uydurmalısın, Gladys.
es: —¡Ah! tendrás que elegir el vestido de acuerdo con sus flores, Gladys.
vi_translation: "Ah! You have to choose a dress that matches his flowers, Gladys."
tr_translation: "You should match the color of your dress to the flowers he gave you, Gladys."
es_translation: —Ah! You will have to choose the dress according to its flowers, Gladys.

en: He went to his room and dressed. There was a wild recklessness of gaiety in his manner as he sat at table, but now and then a thrill of terror ran through him when he remembered that, pressed against the window of the conservatory, like a white handkerchief, he had seen the face of James Vane watching him.
vi: Cậu vào phòng mình và thay đồ. Có một sự khinh suất phóng túng trong thái độ vui vẻ của cậu khi cậu ngồi bên bàn, nhưng thỉnh thoảng một cơn rùng mình kinh sợ lại chạy xuyên qua cậu khi cậu nhớ là, ép vào cửa sổ nhà kính, như một chiếc khăn tay trắng, cậu đã thấy cái mặt James Vane nhìn cậu.
tr: Odasına çıkıp giysilerini değiştirdi. Sofraya oturduğunda dizginsiz, alabildiğine bir neşe içindeydi. Gelgelelim arada bir, limonluk penceresine bir beyaz mendil gibi yapışmış, James Vane’in kendini gözleyen yüzünü görmüş olduğu aklına geldikçe, tepeden tırnağa dehşetle ürperiyordu.
es: Fue a su habitación para vestirse. Cuando se sentó a la mesa, había en su actitud una extraña alegría temeraria, aunque, de cuando en cuando, le recorría un estremecimiento al recordar que, aplastado, como un pañuelo blanco, contra el cristal del invernadero, había visto el rostro de James Vane que lo vigilaba.
vi_translation: You went into your room and changed clothes. There was a careless abandon in your cheerful demeanor as you sat by the table, but occasionally a shudder of fear ran through you when you remembered that, pressed against the greenhouse window like a white handkerchief, you had seen James Vane's face looking at you.
tr_translation: He went up to his room and changed his clothes. When he sat down at the table, he was in an unrestrained, boundless joy. However, every now and then, the thought of having seen James Vane’s face, pressed against the greenhouse window like a white handkerchief, made him shudder with terror from head to toe.
es_translation: He went to his room to get dressed. When he sat down at the table, there was a strange reckless joy in his demeanor, although, from time to time, a shudder ran through him as he remembered that, crushed like a white handkerchief against the glass of the greenhouse, he had seen the face of James Vane watching him.

en: “Not very good, Dorian. I think most of the birds have gone to the open. I dare say it will be better after lunch, when we get to new ground.”
vi: “Không vui lắm, Dorian. Tôi nghĩ hầu hết bọn chim đã bay ra nơi đồng không mông quạnh rồi. Tôi dám nói là sau bữa trưa sẽ vui hơn, khi ta đến khu đất mới.
tr: “Pek de iyi değildi, Dorian. Kuşların çoğu açığa çıkmışlar sanıyorum. Yemekten sonra, yeni bir alana gidince daha iyi olacak, herhalde.
es: —No demasiado buena, Dorian. Me parece que la mayoría de las aves han salido ya a cielo abierto. Espero que tengamos más suerte después del almuerzo, cuando iniciemos otra batida.
vi_translation: "Not very happy, Dorian. I think most of the birds have flown to the desolate fields. I dare say it will be more enjoyable after lunch, when we reach the new land."
tr_translation: “It wasn't very good, Dorian. I think most of the birds have been exposed. After dinner, it will probably be better when we go to a new area.”
es_translation: —Not too good, Dorian. It seems to me that most of the birds have already flown out into the open sky. I hope we have better luck after lunch, when we start another drive.

en: Dorian strolled along by his side. The keen aromatic air, the brown and red lights that glimmered in the wood, the hoarse cries of the beaters ringing out from time to time, and the sharp snaps of the guns that followed, fascinated him and filled him with a sense of delightful freedom. He was dominated by the carelessness of happiness, by the high indifference of joy.
vi: Dorian dạo bước bên y. Không khí thơm ngát, ánh sáng đỏ và nâu le lói trong rừng, tiếng kêu khàn khàn của những người xua dã thú thỉnh thoảng lại vang lên, tiếng súng lách cách sắc nét theo sau, quyến rũ cậu, và khiến cậu ngập tràn cảm xúc tự do thích thú. Cậu bị chi phối hoàn toàn bởi niềm hạnh phúc bất cẩn, bởi niềm hân hoan bàng quang tột đỉnh.
tr: Dorian onun yanı sıra ağır ağır yürümeye başladı. Mis kokulu temiz, ayaz hava, korunun içinde parlayan kahverengi kırmızı ışıklar, kuşları kışkışlayan adamların durup durup çınlayan boğuk bağırışlarıyla bunları izleyen keskin tüfek sesleri onu adeta büyülüyor, içini tatlı bir özgürlük duyusuyla dolduruyordu. Mutluluğun verdiği kaygısızlık, sevincin uyandırdığı umursamazlık şimdi bütün öbür duygularından baskın çıkmıştı.
es: Dorian caminó a su lado. El aire intensamente aromático, los resplandores marrones y rojos que aparecían momentáneamente en el pinar, los gritos roncos de los ojeadores que resonaban de cuando en cuando y el ruido seco de las detonaciones que los seguían eran para él motivo de fascinación, y lo llenaban de un delicioso sentimiento de libertad. Le dominaba la despreocupación de la felicidad, la suprema indiferencia de la alegría.
vi_translation: Dorian walked beside him. The air was fragrant, red and brown light flickered in the forest, the hoarse cries of the beaters occasionally rang out, followed by the sharp clatter of guns, enchanting him, and filling him with a sense of joyful freedom. He was completely dominated by a careless happiness, by an overwhelming sense of euphoric detachment.
tr_translation: Dorian began to walk slowly beside him. The fragrant, clean, crisp air, the brown and red lights shining within the grove, the muffled shouts of the men chasing away the birds, and the sharp sounds of rifles following these shouts almost enchanted him, filling him with a sweet sense of freedom. The carefreeness brought by happiness, the indifference awakened by joy, now dominated all his other feelings.
es_translation: Dorian walked by his side. The intensely aromatic air, the brown and red glows that momentarily appeared in the pine forest, the hoarse cries of the beaters that occasionally echoed, and the dry noise of the gunshots that followed were a source of fascination for him, filling him with a delightful sense of freedom. He was dominated by the carefree nature of happiness, the supreme indifference of joy.

en: “Good heavens! I have hit a beater!” exclaimed Sir Geoffrey. “What an ass the man was to get in front of the guns! Stop shooting there!” he called out at the top of his voice. “A man is hurt.”
vi: “Trời ơi! Tôi bắn trúng một người xua thú rồi!” ngài Geoffrey la lên. “Gã đần nào mà lại chui vào trước họng súng thế này! Đằng kia ngưng bắn đi!” ông ta hét to hết sức mình. “Có người bị thương.
tr: Sir Geoffrey, “Aman Tanrım, kışkışçılardan birini vurdum!” diye bağırdı. “Ne salaklık! Tüfeklerin karşısında durulur mu?” Sonra sesinin var gücüyle, “Hey, oradakiler, ateşi kesin, adam vuruldu!” diye haykırmaya başladı.
es: —¡Cielo santo! ¡He alcanzado a un ojeador! —exclamó sir Geoffrey—. ¡Qué estupidez ponerse delante de las escopetas! ¡Dejen de disparar! —gritó con todas sus fuerzas—. Hay un herido.
vi_translation: “Oh my God! I shot a beater!” Sir Geoffrey shouted. “What kind of fool would walk right into the line of fire! Stop shooting over there!” he yelled at the top of his lungs. “Someone is injured.”
tr_translation: Sir Geoffrey shouted, "My God, I shot one of the beaters!" "What stupidity! Who stands in front of the guns?" Then, with all his might, he started yelling, "Hey, you over there, cease fire, a man has been shot!"
es_translation: —Good heavens! I've hit a beater! —exclaimed Sir Geoffrey—. What stupidity to get in front of the guns! Stop shooting! —he shouted with all his might—. There is an injured person.

en: “Here,” answered Sir Geoffrey angrily, hurrying towards the thicket. “Why on earth don’t you keep your men back? Spoiled my shooting for the day.”
vi: “Đây,” ngài Geoffrey trả lời, giận dữ, vội vã bước về phía bụi cây. “Trời đất ơi, sao anh không giữ người của mình đằng sau? Làm hỏng cả ngày săn của tôi.”
tr: Sir Geoffrey öfkeyle, “Burada,” diye yanıtlayarak fundalığa doğru koştu. “Adamlarını neden geride tutmazsın? Bugünlük av berbat oldu!
es: —Ahí —respondió muy irritado sir Geoffrey, acercándose al bosquecillo—. ¿Por qué demonios no controla a sus hombres? Me han echado a perder toda una jornada de caza.
vi_translation: “Here,” Sir Geoffrey replied angrily, hurrying towards the bushes. “Good heavens, why didn't you keep your men behind? You've ruined my entire hunting day.”
tr_translation: Sir Geoffrey angrily replied, "Here," and ran towards the heath. "Why don't you hold your men back? Today's hunt is ruined!"
es_translation: —There —replied Sir Geoffrey very irritated, approaching the grove—. Why the devil don't you control your men? They have ruined an entire day of hunting for me.

en: “I am afraid so,” rejoined Lord Henry. “He got the whole charge of shot in his chest. He must have died almost instantaneously. Come; let us go home.”
vi: “Tôi e là vậy,” huân tước Henry đáp lại. “Hắn lãnh cả số đạn vào ngực. Chắc hắn đã chết gần như ngay lập tức. Nào; ta hãy về nhà thôi.”
tr: Lord Henry, “Korkarım evet,” diye yanıtladı. “Olanca saçmayı göğsüne yemiş. Anında ölmüş olsa gerek. Yürü, eve dönelim.
es: —Mucho me temo —replicó lord Henry—. La descarga le alcanzó de lleno en el pecho. Debe de haber muerto de manera casi instantánea. Ven; volvamos a casa.
vi_translation: “I’m afraid so,” Lord Henry replied. “He took all the bullets to the chest. He must have died almost instantly. Come; let’s go home.”
tr_translation: Lord Henry replied, "I'm afraid so." "He took all the nonsense to heart. He must have died instantly. Come on, let's go home."
es_translation: —I greatly fear so —replied Lord Henry—. The shot hit him squarely in the chest. He must have died almost instantly. Come; let's go back home.

en: The elder man laughed. “The only horrible thing in the world is ennui, Dorian. That is the one sin for which there is no forgiveness. But we are not likely to suffer from it unless these fellows keep chattering about this thing at dinner. I must tell them that the subject is to be tabooed. As for omens, there is no such thing as an omen. Destiny does not send us heralds. She is too wise or too cruel for that. Besides, what on earth could happen to you, Dorian? You have everything in the world that a man can want. There is no one who would not be delighted to change places with you.”
vi: Người lớn hơn bật cười. “Thứ duy nhất khủng khiếp trên đời này là buồn chán, Dorian à. Đó là một tội lỗi không được tha thứ. Nhưng chắc ta cũng không phải chịu đựng nó đâu, trừ phi những ông bạn ấy cứ bép xép về chuyện này ở bữa tối. Tôi phải dặn họ là chủ đề này bị cấm. Còn về điềm báo, không có cái thứ nào như một điềm báo cả. Số phận không gửi sứ giả đến cho ta. Về phần này, bà ấy quá khôn hoặc quá ác. Ngoài ra, liệu trên trần gian còn chuyện gì có thể xảy ra với cậu được, Dorian? Cậu có mọi thứ mà con người có thể cần đến. Không một ai lại không vui lòng đổi chỗ với cậu.”
tr: Arkadaşı güldü. “Dünyada tek feci şey can sıkıntısıdır Dorian. Hiç bağışlanmayan tek günah odur. Neyse, bizim bu felakete uğramamız olası değil, bu heriflerin sofrada da bu olayı ağızlarında çiğneyip durmaları dışında. Konunun tabu olduğunu onlara söyleyeyim bari. Uğursuzluk belirtisine gelince, yok böyle şey. Kaderin bizlere önceden haberci göndermek gibi bir huyu yoktur. Bunu yapmayacak kadar bilgedir o ya da acımasız: Hem zaten kuzum Dorian, ne gelebilir ki senin başına? İnsanın isteyebileceği her şeye sahipsin. Kim desen seve seve yer değiştirir seninle.
es: Su amigo de más edad se echó a reír. —Lo único horrible en el mundo es el ennui, Dorian. Ése es el único pecado que no tiene perdón. Pero no es probable que lo padezcamos, a no ser que nuestros amigos sigan hablando durante la cena de lo sucedido. He de decirles que es un tema tabú. En cuanto a presagios, no existe nada semejante. El destino no nos envía heraldos. Es demasiado prudente o demasiado cruel para eso. Además, ¿qué demonios podría sucederte? Tienes todo lo que un hombre puede desear. Cualquiera se cambiaría por ti.
vi_translation: The older person laughed. “The only terrible thing in this world is boredom, Dorian. It is an unforgivable sin. But surely we don't have to endure it, unless those friends of ours keep babbling about it at dinner. I must tell them that this topic is forbidden. As for omens, there is no such thing as an omen. Fate does not send messengers to us. In this regard, she is either too wise or too cruel. Besides, what on earth could possibly happen to you, Dorian? You have everything a person could need. No one would be unwilling to trade places with you.”
tr_translation: His friend laughed. “The only dreadful thing in the world is boredom, Dorian. It is the only sin for which there is no forgiveness. Anyway, it is unlikely that we will suffer from this calamity, except for these guys chewing over the same topic at the table. I might as well tell them that the subject is taboo. As for the sign of bad luck, there is no such thing. Fate does not have the habit of sending us a warning in advance. It is too wise or too ruthless to do so: Besides, my dear Dorian, what could possibly happen to you? You have everything a person could desire. Anyone would gladly trade places with you.”
es_translation: His older friend burst out laughing. —The only horrible thing in the world is ennui, Dorian. That is the only sin that is unforgivable. But it is unlikely that we will suffer from it, unless our friends continue talking during dinner about what happened. I must tell them that it is a taboo subject. As for omens, there is no such thing. Fate does not send us heralds. It is too prudent or too cruel for that. Besides, what the hell could happen to you? You have everything a man could desire. Anyone would trade places with you.

en: “There is no one with whom I would not change places, Harry. Don’t laugh like that. I am telling you the truth. The wretched peasant who has just died is better off than I am. I have no terror of death. It is the coming of death that terrifies me. Its monstrous wings seem to wheel in the leaden air around me. Good heavens! don’t you see a man moving behind the trees there, watching me, waiting for me?”
vi: “Không có một ai mà tôi lại không muốn đổi chỗ với họ, Harry. Đừng cười như thế. Tôi đang nói sự thật với anh. Người nông dân cùng khổ vừa mới chết ấy cũng sung sướng hơn tôi. Tôi không sợ Cái chết. Chính sự tiếp cận của Cái chết mới làm tôi khiếp sợ. Đôi cánh khổng lồ của nó dường như đương lượn vòng trên không khí xám chì quanh tôi. Trời ơi! Anh có thấy một người đang di chuyển sau những cái cây đằng kia, theo dõi tôi, chờ đợi tôi không?”
tr: “Ben de kim isterse onunla yer değiştiririm Harry. Gülmesene öyle. Biraz önce ölen o sefil köylünün bile durumu benden daha iyi. Ölümden korkum yok benim. Beni dehşete düşüren ölümün gelişidir. Ölümün o dev kanatları çevremizdeki şu kurşun gibi ağır havanın içinde kulaç atıyor sanki. Aman Tanrım! Şu ağaçların ardında bir adam var, görmüyor musun? Beni gözetliyor, yolumu bekliyor.
es: —No hay nadie con quien yo no estaría dispuesto a cambiarme, Harry. No te rías así. Te estoy diciendo la verdad. Ese pobre campesino que acaba de morir es más afortunado que yo. No le tengo miedo a la muerte. Es su forma de llegar lo que me aterroriza. Sus alas monstruosas parecen girar en el aire plomizo a mi alrededor. ¡Dios del cielo! ¿No has visto a un hombre moviéndose detrás de aquellos árboles, un individuo que me vigila, que me está esperando?
vi_translation: “There is no one I wouldn't want to trade places with, Harry. Don't laugh like that. I'm telling you the truth. Even that poor farmer who just died is happier than I am. I'm not afraid of Death. It's the approach of Death that terrifies me. Its enormous wings seem to be circling in the leaden gray air around me. Oh my God! Do you see someone moving behind those trees over there, watching me, waiting for me?”
tr_translation: “I would switch places with anyone who wants, Harry. Don't laugh like that. Even the wretched peasant who just died is in a better situation than me. I'm not afraid of death. What horrifies me is the approach of death. It's as if death's giant wings are swimming through this leaden air around us. My God! There's a man behind those trees, don't you see? He's watching me, waiting for my path.”
es_translation: —There is no one with whom I wouldn't be willing to trade places, Harry. Don't laugh like that. I'm telling you the truth. That poor peasant who just died is luckier than I am. I'm not afraid of death. It's the way it comes that terrifies me. Its monstrous wings seem to whirl in the leaden air around me. Good heavens! Didn't you see a man moving behind those trees, an individual who is watching me, who is waiting for me?

en: Lord Henry looked in the direction in which the trembling gloved hand was pointing. “Yes,” he said, smiling, “I see the gardener waiting for you. I suppose he wants to ask you what flowers you wish to have on the table to-night. How absurdly nervous you are, my dear fellow! You must come and see my doctor, when we get back to town.”
vi: Huân tước Henry nhìn theo hướng mà bàn tay đeo găng run rẩy ấy đang chỉ. “Vâng,” y vừa cười vừa nói, “tôi thấy người làm vườn đang chờ cậu. Tôi cho là hắn cần hỏi cậu xem cậu muốn có những bông hoa nào trên bàn đêm nay. Sao mà cậu lại bất an một cách vô lý đến vậy, bạn ơi! Cậu phải đến gặp bác sỹ của tôi, khi ta quay về thành phố.”
tr: Lord Henry o titreyen, eldivenli elin imlediği yöne baktı. Gülümseyerek, “Evet,” diye karşılık verdi. “Bahçıvanın seni beklediğini görüyorum. Bu gece sofrada hangi çiçekleri istediğini sormak istiyor olsa gerek. Sinirlerin gülünç derecede gergin, yavrucuğum. Kente döndüğümüzde mutlaka git, benim doktoruma görün.
es: Lord Henry miró en la dirección que señalaba la temblorosa mano enguantada. —Sí —dijo sonriendo—; veo un jardinero que te espera. Imagino que desea preguntarte qué flores quieres esta noche en la mesa. ¡Qué increíblemente nervioso estás, mi querido amigo! Has de ir a ver a mi médico cuando vuelvas a Londres.
vi_translation: Lord Henry looked in the direction the trembling gloved hand was pointing. "Yes," he said with a smile, "I see the gardener waiting for you. I suppose he needs to ask you which flowers you want on the table tonight. Why are you so unreasonably anxious, my friend! You must see my doctor when we return to the city."
tr_translation: Lord Henry shivered and looked in the direction indicated by the gloved hand. Smiling, he replied, "Yes." "I see the gardener is waiting for you. He probably wants to ask which flowers you want on the table tonight. Your nerves are ridiculously tense, my dear. When we return to the city, you must go see my doctor."
es_translation: Lord Henry looked in the direction indicated by the trembling gloved hand. —Yes —he said, smiling—; I see a gardener waiting for you. I imagine he wants to ask you which flowers you want on the table tonight. How incredibly nervous you are, my dear friend! You must go see my doctor when you return to London.

en: “How fond women are of doing dangerous things!” laughed Lord Henry. “It is one of the qualities in them that I admire most. A woman will flirt with anybody in the world as long as other people are looking on.”
vi: “Sao mà đàn bà ưa làm những việc nguy hiểm thế cơ chứ!” huân tước Henry cười. “Đó là một trong các phẩm chất ở họ mà tôi ngưỡng mộ nhất. Đàn bà sẽ đong đưa với bất cứ ai trên đời này chừng nào mà những người khác còn để ý đến.”
tr: Lord Henry gülerek, “Şu kadın milleti tehlikeli şeyleri nasıl da severler!” dedi. “Benim en hayran olduğum niteliklerinden biridir. Yeter ki herkesin gözü önünde olsun.
es: —¡Cuánto les gusta a las mujeres hacer cosas peligrosas! —rió lord Henry—. Es una de las cualidades que más admiro en ellas. Una mujer puede coquetear con cualquiera con tal de que haya otras personas mirando.
vi_translation: “Why do women like to do such dangerous things!” Lord Henry laughed. “That is one of the qualities in them that I admire the most. Women will flirt with anyone in the world as long as others are paying attention.”
tr_translation: Lord Henry laughed, "How women love dangerous things!" he said. "It is one of the qualities I admire most about them. As long as it is in front of everyone."
es_translation: —How much women love to do dangerous things! —laughed Lord Henry—. It is one of the qualities I admire most in them. A woman can flirt with anyone as long as there are other people watching.

en: “You are talking scandal, Harry, and there is never any basis for scandal.”
vi: “Anh đơm đặt rồi đấy, Harry, mà chẳng hề có cơ sở nào để đơm đặt chuyện gì.
tr: “Sen skandaldan konuşuyorsun, Harry. Oysa skandal için ortada hiçbir dayanak yok.
es: —¡Eso es difamación, Harry, y nunca hay motivo alguno para la difamación!
vi_translation: "You're making things up, Harry, without any basis for it.""
tr_translation: "You are talking about a scandal, Harry. However, there is no basis for a scandal."
es_translation: —That is defamation, Harry, and there is never any reason for defamation!

en: “All ways end at the same point, my dear Gladys.”
vi: “Đường nào cũng kết thúc tại cùng một điểm, Gladys ơi.”
tr: “Bütün yolların sonu aynı noktaya çıkar, biricik Gladys.
es: —Todos los caminos llevan al mismo sitio, mi querida Gladys.
vi_translation: "All roads end at the same point, Gladys."
tr_translation: “All roads lead to the same point, my dear Gladys.”
es_translation: —All roads lead to the same place, my dear Gladys.

en: “You would miss them,” said Lord Henry.
vi: “Cô sẽ nhớ chúng,” huân tước Henry nói.
tr: Lord Henry, “Yitirirsen ararsın,” dedi.
es: —Las echarías de menos —dijo lord Henry.
vi_translation: “She will miss them,” Lord Henry said.
tr_translation: Lord Henry, "You lose it, you search for it," he said.
es_translation: —You would miss them —said Lord Henry.

en: “Don’t know who he is?” said Dorian, listlessly. “What do you mean? Wasn’t he one of your men?”
vi: “Không biết anh ta là ai?” Dorian hỏi, thờ ơ. “Ý anh muốn nói gì? Chẳng lẽ anh ta không phải là người của anh sao?”
tr: Dorian sıkıntılı bir sesle, “Kim olduğunu bilmiyor musunuz?” diye sordu. “Ne demek yani? Senin adamlarından biri değil mi?
es: —¿No saben quién es? —preguntó Dorian distraídamente—. ¿Qué quiere decir? ¿No era uno de sus hombres?
vi_translation: “Don't know who he is?” Dorian asked, indifferently. “What do you mean? Isn't he your man?”
tr_translation: Dorian asked in a troubled voice, "Don't you know who he is?" "What do you mean? Isn't he one of your men?"
es_translation: —Don't you know who he is? —asked Dorian distractedly—. What do you mean? Wasn't he one of your men?

en: The pen dropped from Dorian Gray’s hand, and he felt as if his heart had suddenly stopped beating. “A sailor?” he cried out. “Did you say a sailor?”
vi: Cây bút rớt khỏi tay Dorian Gray, cậu cảm thấy như thể tim bất ngờ ngừng đập. “Thủy thủ?” cậu la lên. “Có phải anh nói một thủy thủ không?”
tr: Kalem elinden düştü ve Dorian’ın yüreği birden duruvermiş gibi oldu. “Gemici mi?” diye bağırdı. “Gemici mi dedin?
es: A Dorian Gray se le cayó la pluma de la mano, y tuvo la sensación de que el corazón dejaba de latirle. —¿Un marinero? —exclamó—. ¿Ha dicho un marinero?
vi_translation: The pen dropped from Dorian Gray's hand, he felt as if his heart had suddenly stopped beating. "A sailor?" he exclaimed. "Did you say a sailor?"
tr_translation: The pen fell from his hand and it was as if Dorian's heart suddenly stopped. “A sailor?” he shouted. “Did you say a sailor?”
es_translation: Dorian Gray dropped the pen from his hand and felt as if his heart had stopped beating. —A sailor? —he exclaimed—. Did you say a sailor?

en: “Was there anything found on him?” said Dorian, leaning forward and looking at the man with startled eyes. “Anything that would tell his name?”
vi: “Có tìm thấy gì trên người anh ta không?” Dorian nói, cúi về phía trước và nhìn người đó với đôi mắt thảng thốt. “Bất cứ thứ gì có thể cho biết tên anh ta?”
tr: Dorian öne doğru eğilerek şaşırmış gözlerle korucunun yüzünü taradı. “Üzerinden bir şey çıktı mı? Adını sanını gösteren bir şey?
es: —¿Llevaba algo encima? —preguntó Dorian, inclinándose hacia adelante y mirando al guardabosque con ojos llenos de sobresalto—. ¿Algo que nos permita saber su nombre?
vi_translation: “Did you find anything on him?” Dorian said, leaning forward and looking at the person with startled eyes. “Anything that could tell us his name?”
tr_translation: Dorian leaned forward and scanned the ranger's face with surprised eyes. "Did anything come out of him? Something that shows his name or identity?"
es_translation: —Did he have anything on him? —asked Dorian, leaning forward and looking at the gamekeeper with eyes full of shock—. Anything that would allow us to know his name?

en: Dorian started to his feet. A terrible hope fluttered past him. He clutched at it madly. “Where is the body?” he exclaimed. “Quick! I must see it at once.”
vi: Dorian đứng phắt dậy. Một hy vọng khủng khiếp dập dờn bay ngang qua cậu. Cậu điên cuồng chộp lấy nó. “Cái xác đâu rồi?” cậu la lên. “Nhanh! Tôi phải thấy nó ngay.”
tr: Dorian yerinden fırlamıştı. Müthiş bir umut kanat çırparak yanından sıyırıp geçti. Dorian deli gibi sarıldı bu umuda. “Ceset nerede?” diye haykırdı. “Çabuk! Hemen görmek istiyorum.
es: Dorian se puso en pie. Una imposible esperanza le rozó con su ala y se agarró a ella con frenesí. —¿Dónde está el cadáver? —exclamó—. ¡Deprisa! He de verlo cuanto antes.
vi_translation: Dorian stood up abruptly. A terrible hope fluttered across him. He desperately grasped at it. “Where is the body?” he shouted. “Quick! I must see it immediately.”
tr_translation: Dorian jumped up from his seat. A tremendous hope fluttered past him. Dorian clung to this hope like a madman. “Where is the body?” he shouted. “Quick! I want to see it immediately.”
es_translation: Dorian stood up. An impossible hope brushed him with its wing, and he clung to it frantically. —Where is the corpse? —he exclaimed—. Quickly! I must see it as soon as possible.

en: Dorian Gray shuddered. He felt that his could not be the hand to take the handkerchief away, and called out to one of the farm-servants to come to him.
vi: Dorian Gray rùng mình. Cậu cảm thấy mình không thể tự tay lấy cái khăn tay ra, và lớn tiếng gọi một tá điền đến chỗ cậu.
tr: Dorian Gray ürperdi. Kendisinin o mendili dünyada kaldıramayacağını anlayarak ırgatlardan birini yanına çağırdı.
es: Dorian Gray se estremeció. Sintió que no podía ser su mano la que retirase el pañuelo, y pidió a uno de los gañanes que se acercara.
vi_translation: Dorian Gray shuddered. He felt that he could not take out the handkerchief himself, and loudly called a tenant over to him.
tr_translation: Dorian Gray shuddered. Realizing that he could not lift that handkerchief himself, he called one of the laborers over.
es_translation: Dorian Gray shuddered. He felt that it could not be his hand that removed the handkerchief, and asked one of the laborers to come closer.

en: “There is no use your telling me that you are going to be good,” cried Lord Henry, dipping his white fingers into a red copper bowl filled with rose-water. “You are quite perfect. Pray, don’t change.”
vi: "Cậu bảo tôi là cậu sẽ sống tử tế thì cũng chẳng ích gì,” huân tước Henry kêu lên, nhúng các ngón tay trắng vào một tô đồng đỏ đựng đầy nước hồng. “Cậu đã hoàn hảo lắm rồi. Xin đấy, đừng thay đổi.
tr: Lord Henry, “İyi insan olacağım, deyip durmanın bir yararı yok,” diyerek o beyaz parmaklarını gülsuyu dolu bakır bir tasa batırdı. “Kusursuzsun sen. Kuzum, değişme.
es: —No me digas que vas a ser bueno —exclamó lord Henry, sumergiendo los dedos en un cuenco de cobre rojo lleno de agua de rosas—. Eres absolutamente perfecto. Haz el favor de no cambiar.
vi_translation: "You told me that you would live decently, but it doesn't help at all," Lord Henry exclaimed, dipping his white fingers into a red copper bowl filled with rose water. "You are already perfect. Please, don't change."
tr_translation: Lord Henry, "There is no use in saying I will be a good person," he said, dipping his white fingers into a copper bowl filled with rose water. "You are perfect. My dear, do not change."
es_translation: —Don't tell me you're going to be good —exclaimed Lord Henry, dipping his fingers into a red copper bowl filled with rose water—. You are absolutely perfect. Do me a favor and don't change.

en: “My dear boy,” said Lord Henry, smiling, “anybody can be good in the country. There are no temptations there. That is the reason why people who live out of town are so absolutely uncivilized. Civilization is not by any means an easy thing to attain to. There are only two ways by which man can reach it. One is by being cultured, the other by being corrupt. Country people have no opportunity of being either, so they stagnate.”
vi: “Chàng trai của tôi,” huân tước Henry nói, mỉm cười, “ai cũng có thể tử tế ở quê. Nơi ấy không có cám dỗ. Đó là lý do tại sao mà những người sống ngoài thành phố lại hoàn toàn thiếu văn minh như vậy. Sự văn minh dẫu gì cũng không phải cái dễ đạt được. Chỉ có hai con đường để con người có thể tiếp cận nó. Một là được giáo hóa, hai là bị tha hóa. Người nhà quê không có cơ hội với cả hai, nên họ trì độn."
tr: Lord Henry, “Sevgili dostum,” dedi gülümseyerek. “Kent dışında herkes uslu oturur. Baştan çıkarıcı bir şey yok ki orada. Kent dışında yaşayan kimselerin uygarlıktan iyice uzak olmaları da bu yüzdendir ya. Uygarlık, ulaşılması hiç de kolay olan bir şey değildir. Kişi ancak iki yoldan ulaşabilir uygarlığa. Biri kültürlü olmak, öbürü de ahlaksız olmak. Kent dışında yaşayanlar bunların ikisine de fırsat bulamadıkları için durgun sular gibi yosun tutup giderler.
es: —Mi querido muchacho —dijo lord Henry sonriendo—, cualquiera puede ser bueno en el campo, donde no existen tentaciones. Ése es el motivo de que las personas que no habitan en ciudades vivan todavía en estado de barbarie. La civilización no es algo que se consiga fácilmente. Sólo hay dos maneras. O se es culto o se está corrompido. La gente del campo carece de ocasiones para ambas cosas, de manera que sólo conocen el estancamiento.
vi_translation: “My boy,” Lord Henry said, smiling, “anyone can be good in the countryside. There are no temptations there. That is why people who live outside the city are so completely uncivilized. Civilization is not something easily achieved. There are only two ways for a person to approach it. One is through education, the other is through corruption. Country folk have no opportunity for either, so they remain dull."
tr_translation: Lord Henry, "My dear friend," he said with a smile. "Everyone behaves well outside the city. There is nothing seductive there. That is why those who live outside the city are quite far from civilization. Civilization is not something that is easy to attain. One can only reach civilization in two ways. One is by being cultured, the other by being immoral. Since those who live outside the city have no opportunity for either, they become stagnant waters covered with algae."
es_translation: —My dear boy —said Lord Henry, smiling—, anyone can be good in the countryside, where there are no temptations. That is why people who do not live in cities still live in a state of barbarism. Civilization is not something that is easily achieved. There are only two ways. Either one is cultured or one is corrupt. Country people lack opportunities for both, so they only know stagnation.

en: “The people are still discussing poor Basil’s disappearance.”
vi: “Mọi người vẫn còn bàn tán về sự biến mất của Basil tội nghiệp.
tr: “Herkes hâlâ zavallı Basil’in ortadan yitişini konuşuyor.
es: —La gente sigue hablando de la desaparición del pobre Basil.
vi_translation: “Everyone is still talking about poor Basil's disappearance.”
tr_translation: “Everyone is still talking about poor Basil's disappearance.”
es_translation: —People are still talking about the disappearance of poor Basil.

en: “I should have thought they had got tired of that by this time,” said Dorian, pouring himself out some wine and frowning slightly.
vi: “Tôi cứ tưởng là đến lúc này thì họ đã chán chuyện ấy rồi,” Dorian nói, rót cho mình ít rượu, và hơi nhăn mặt.
tr: Dorian hafifçe yüzünü buruşturup bardağına biraz şarap alarak, “Şimdiye kadar bu konudan usanacaklarını sanmıştım,” dedi.
es: —Yo pensaba que ya se habrían cansado después de tanto tiempo —exclamó Dorian, sirviéndose un poco más de vino y frunciendo ligeramente el ceño.
vi_translation: "I thought they would be tired of that by now," Dorian said, pouring himself some wine, and slightly grimacing.
tr_translation: Dorian slightly grimaced and, pouring himself some wine, said, "I thought they would have been tired of this topic by now."
es_translation: —I thought they would have gotten tired after so much time —exclaimed Dorian, pouring himself a bit more wine and slightly furrowing his brow.

en: “I would say, my dear fellow, that you were posing for a character that doesn’t suit you. All crime is vulgar, just as all vulgarity is crime. It is not in you, Dorian, to commit a murder. I am sorry if I hurt your vanity by saying so, but I assure you it is true. Crime belongs exclusively to the lower orders. I don’t blame them in the smallest degree. I should fancy that crime was to them what art is to us, simply a method of procuring extraordinary sensations.”
vi: “Tôi sẽ nói, bạn yêu quý ơi, là cậu đang diễn một nhân vật không hợp với mình. Mọi tội ác đều thô tục, hệt như mọi sự thô tục đều là tội lỗi. Cậu không có khả năng, Dorian, phạm tội giết người. Tôi xin lỗi nếu tôi làm tổn thương niềm kiêu hãnh của cậu vì nói vậy, nhưng tôi cam đoan với cậu là đó là sự thật. Tội ác thuộc riêng về tầng lớp dưới. Tôi không đổ lỗi cho họ chút nào. Tôi có thể hình dung là tội ác với họ cũng như nghệ thuật với chúng ta, chỉ là một phương pháp tìm cảm giác lạ.”
tr: “Sana yakışmayan bir rol oynuyorsun, derim, dostum. Bütün ağır suçlar bayağıdır, aynı zamanda bütün bayağılıklar da ağır bir suçtur. Cinayet işlemek sana göre değil, Dorian. Böyle demekle gururunu incitiyorsam üzgünüm, ama inan bana, doğruyu söylüyorum. Ağır suçlar tümüyle aşağı sınıflara özgüdür. Onları zerrece kınamıyorum. Bana öyle geliyor ki bizim için sanat neyse onlar için de suç işlemek o: yani olağandışı heyecanlar yaratmanın bir yöntemi.
es: —Diría, mi querido amigo, que tratas de representar un papel que no te va en absoluto. Todo delito es vulgar, de la misma manera que todo lo vulgar es delito. No está en tu naturaleza, Dorian, cometer un asesinato. Siento herir tu vanidad diciéndolo, pero te aseguro que es verdad. El crimen pertenece en exclusiva a las clases bajas. No se lo censuro ni por lo más remoto. Imagino que para ellos es como el arte para nosotros, una manera de procurarse sensaciones extraordinarias.
vi_translation: “I would say, my dear friend, that you are playing a character that does not suit you. All crime is vulgar, just as all vulgarity is a crime. You do not have the capacity, Dorian, to commit murder. I apologize if I hurt your pride by saying so, but I assure you that it is the truth. Crime belongs exclusively to the lower classes. I do not blame them at all. I can imagine that crime to them is like art to us, merely a method of seeking new sensations.”
tr_translation: “You are playing a role that doesn't suit you, my friend, I would say. All serious crimes are vulgar, and at the same time, all vulgarities are serious crimes. Committing murder is not for you, Dorian. If saying this hurts your pride, I am sorry, but believe me, I am telling the truth. Serious crimes are entirely characteristic of the lower classes. I do not condemn them in the slightest. It seems to me that committing crimes for them is what art is for us: a method of creating extraordinary excitements.”
es_translation: —I would say, my dear friend, that you are trying to play a role that does not suit you at all. Every crime is vulgar, just as everything vulgar is a crime. It is not in your nature, Dorian, to commit a murder. I regret hurting your vanity by saying this, but I assure you it is true. Crime belongs exclusively to the lower classes. I do not blame them in the slightest. I imagine that for them it is like art is for us, a way to procure extraordinary sensations.

en: Lord Henry laughed. “If a man treats life artistically, his brain is his heart,” he answered, sinking into an arm-chair.
vi: Huân tước Henry bật cười. “Nếu ai nhìn đời như nghệ sỹ, não hắn là tim hắn,” y trả lời, hạ mình xuống ghế bành.
tr: Lord Henry güldü. “İnsan hayatı da sanat yerine koyarsa, kalbi beynidir,” diyerek bir koltuğa gömüldü.
es: Lord Henry se echó a reír. —Si una persona trata la vida artísticamente, su cerebro es su alma —respondió, hundiéndose en un sillón.
vi_translation: Lord Henry laughed. "If one looks at life as an artist, his brain is his heart," he replied, lowering himself into an armchair.
tr_translation: Lord Henry laughed. "If one treats life as a work of art, the heart is the brain," he said, sinking into an armchair.
es_translation: Lord Henry burst out laughing. —If a person treats life artistically, their brain is their soul —he replied, sinking into an armchair.

en: Dorian Gray shook his head and struck some soft chords on the piano. “‘Like the painting of a sorrow,’” he repeated, “‘a face without a heart.’”
vi: Dorian Gray lắc đầu, gõ vài hợp âm dịu dàng lên dương cầm. “Như bức tranh đau buồn,” cậu nhắc lại, “một bộ mặt không tim.”
tr: Dorian Gray başını salladı, sonra piyanoda birkaç yumuşak nota çaldı. “Bir hüznün resmi gibi,” diye yineledi. “Kalbi olmayan bir yüz.
es: Dorian Gray movió la cabeza y extrajo del piano algunos acordes melancólicos. —«Imagen de dolor» —repitió—, «rostro sin alma».
vi_translation: Dorian Gray shook his head, gently striking a few chords on the piano. "Like the sorrowful painting," he repeated, "a heartless face."
tr_translation: Dorian Gray shook his head, then played a few soft notes on the piano. "Like a picture of sadness," he repeated. "A face without a heart."
es_translation: Dorian Gray shook his head and drew some melancholy chords from the piano. —"Image of pain" —he repeated—, "soulless face."

en: “My dear fellow,” said Lord Henry, elevating his eyebrows in surprise, “I asked you because I thought you might be able to give me an answer. That is all. I was going through the park last Sunday, and close by the Marble Arch there stood a little crowd of shabby-looking people listening to some vulgar street-preacher. As I passed by, I heard the man yelling out that question to his audience. It struck me as being rather dramatic. London is very rich in curious effects of that kind. A wet Sunday, an uncouth Christian in a mackintosh, a ring of sickly white faces under a broken roof of dripping umbrellas, and a wonderful phrase flung into the air by shrill hysterical lips—it was really very good in its way, quite a suggestion. I thought of telling the prophet that art had a soul, but that man had not. I am afraid, however, he would not have understood me.”
vi: “Bạn yêu ơi,” huân tước Henry nói, nhướng mày lên ngạc nhiên, “tôi hỏi cậu vì tôi tưởng cậu có thể cho tôi câu trả lời. Chỉ vậy thôi. Chủ Nhật vừa rồi, tôi đi qua Công viên, và gần Cổng vòm Cẩm thạch có một đám ít người nhìn tiều tụy đang nghe một gã thuyết pháp đường phố tầm thường nào đó. Lúc đi ngang qua, tôi nghe gã đó hét to câu hỏi ấy cho khán giả của mình. Nó khiến tôi chú ý đến do khá là kịch tính. London rất giàu các ấn tượng kỳ lạ kiểu này. Một Chủ Nhật ướt át, một tín đồ Cơ đốc giáo thô lỗ mặc áo mưa, một vòng mặt người trắng xanh ốm yếu dưới mái vòm nhấp nhô từ những chiếc ô đẫm nước, và một lời chấn động tâm can bị ném vào không khí bởi đôi môi cuồng loạn, the thé — nó thật sự là rất tuyệt theo cách riêng, đúng là một sự ám thị. Tôi nghĩ về việc nói với nhà tiên tri ấy rằng Nghệ thuật có linh hồn, nhưng người thì không. Tôi e là, tuy vậy, có lẽ hắn cũng không hiểu tôi.”
tr: Lord Henry kaşlarını şaşkın şaşkın kaldırarak, “İki gözüm, belki bana bilgi verebilirsin diye düşündüğüm için sordum,” diye yanıtladı. “Hepsi bu. Geçen pazar parktan geçiyordum; Mermer Kemer’in orada bir küme partal giyimli adam durmuş, kılıksız bir sokak vaizini dinlemekteydiler. Geçtiğim sırada herifin bağırarak dinleyenlere bu soruyu sorduğunu duydum. Bir hayli dramatik geldi bana. Londra’mız buna benzer garip sahneler yönünden çok zengin doğrusu. Yağmurlu bir pazar günü, sırtı yağmurluklu, hırt bir Hıristiyan, suları akan şemsiyelerin oluşturduğu delik deşik bir çatı, altında halka olmuş soluk beyaz yüzler... Sonra tiz, isterik bir sesle havaya fırlatılan nefis bir tümce... Gerçekten fevkaladeydi kendi çapında, eni konu etkiliyordu insanı. O peygamber geçinen vaize söylemek geldi içimden: Sanatın ruhu var ama insanın ruhu yoktur, diye. Ama benim ne demek istediğimi anlamayacaktı, nasılsa.
es: —Mi querido amigo —dijo lord Henry, alzando las cejas en un gesto de sorpresa—, te lo preguntaba porque te creía capaz de darme una respuesta. Eso es todo. Cuando iba por el Parque este último domingo, me encontré, cerca de Marble Arch, un grupito de gente mal vestida escuchando a un vulgar predicador callejero. Cuando pasaba por delante, oí cómo aquel hombre le gritaba esa pregunta a su público. Todo ello me pareció bastante dramático. En Londres abundan los efectos curiosos como ése. Un domingo lluvioso, un vulgar cristiano con un impermeable, un círculo de blancos rostros enfermizos bajo un techo desigual de paraguas goteantes, y una frase maravillosa lanzada al aire por unos labios histéricos y una voz chillona..., estuvo bastante bien, a su manera: toda una sugerencia. Se me ocurrió decirle al profeta que el Arte sí tiene un alma, pero no el ser humano. Mucho me temo, de todos modos, que no me hubiera entendido.
vi_translation: “My dear friend,” Lord Henry said, raising an eyebrow in surprise, “I asked you because I thought you might be able to give me an answer. That's all. Last Sunday, I was passing through the Park, and near the Marble Arch, there was a small group of haggard-looking people listening to some mediocre street preacher. As I walked by, I heard him shout that question to his audience. It caught my attention because it was quite dramatic. London is very rich in such strange impressions. A rainy Sunday, a coarse Christian zealot in a raincoat, a circle of pale, sickly faces under the arch bobbing from waterlogged umbrellas, and a soul-stirring proclamation thrown into the air by frenzied, shrill lips — it was truly quite wonderful in its own way, a real suggestion. I thought about telling that prophet that Art has a soul, but man does not. I fear, however, that he might not have understood me.”
tr_translation: Lord Henry raised his eyebrows in surprise and replied, "My dear, I asked because I thought you might be able to inform me." "That's all. Last Sunday, I was passing through the park; near the Marble Arch, a group of shabbily dressed men had stopped and were listening to a scruffy street preacher. As I passed by, I heard the fellow shouting this question to his listeners. It struck me as quite dramatic. Our London is indeed very rich in such strange scenes. A rainy Sunday, a scruffy Christian in a raincoat, a tattered roof formed by dripping umbrellas, and pale white faces gathered underneath... Then a splendid sentence thrown into the air in a shrill, hysterical voice... It was truly extraordinary in its own way, quite affecting. I felt like telling that so-called prophet: Art has a soul, but man does not. But he wouldn't have understood what I meant, anyway."
es_translation: —My dear friend —said Lord Henry, raising his eyebrows in a gesture of surprise—, I asked you because I thought you capable of giving me an answer. That's all. When I was walking through the Park this past Sunday, I came across, near Marble Arch, a small group of poorly dressed people listening to a vulgar street preacher. As I was passing by, I heard that man shouting that question to his audience. It all seemed quite dramatic to me. London abounds with curious effects like that. A rainy Sunday, a vulgar Christian in a raincoat, a circle of pale sickly faces under an uneven roof of dripping umbrellas, and a wonderful phrase thrown into the air by hysterical lips and a shrill voice... it was quite good, in its own way: quite suggestive. It occurred to me to tell the prophet that Art does have a soul, but not the human being. I'm very much afraid, however, that he wouldn't have understood me.

en: “I am not the same, Harry.”
vi: “Tôi không còn như thế nữa đâu, Harry.”
tr: “Değilim Harry.
es: —No soy el mismo, Harry.
vi_translation: “I'm not like that anymore, Harry.”
tr_translation: “I'm not, Harry.”
es_translation: —I'm not the same, Harry.

en: “Yet you poisoned me with a book once. I should not forgive that. Harry, promise me that you will never lend that book to any one. It does harm.”
vi: “Tuy nhiên anh đã đầu độc tôi bằng một cuốn sách, trước kia. Tôi không thể tha thứ cho việc ấy. Harry, hãy hứa với tôi là anh sẽ không bao giờ cho bất cứ ai mượn cuốn sách ấy nữa. Nó gây hại.”
tr: “Oysa bir zamanlar sen beni bir kitapla zehirledin. Bu yüzden seni hiç bağışlamamam gerekir. Harry, bu kitabı kimseye vermeyeceğine yemin et. Çok zarar veriyor.
es: —En una ocasión, sin embargo, me envenenaste con un libro. Eso no lo olvidaré. Harry, prométeme que nunca le prestarás ese libro a nadie. Hace daño.
vi_translation: “However, you poisoned me with a book, before. I cannot forgive that. Harry, promise me that you will never lend that book to anyone else again. It is harmful.”
tr_translation: "Yet once upon a time, you poisoned me with a book. For this reason, I should never forgive you. Harry, swear that you will not give this book to anyone. It causes a lot of harm."
es_translation: —On one occasion, however, you poisoned me with a book. I will not forget that. Harry, promise me that you will never lend that book to anyone. It causes harm.

en: “Must I really come, Harry?”
vi: “Tôi phải đến thật à, Harry?”
tr: “Gelmesem olmaz mı, Harry?
es: —¿Es necesario que venga, Harry?
vi_translation: "Do I really have to go, Harry?"
tr_translation: "Do I have to come, Harry?"
es_translation: —Is it necessary for me to come, Harry?

en: “Mr. Dorian Gray’s, sir,” answered the policeman.
vi: “Của mít-tơ Dorian Gray, thưa ngài,” viên cảnh sát trả lời.
tr: Adam, “mr Dorian Gray’in, efendim,” dedi.
es: —El señor Dorian Gray—respondió el policía.
vi_translation: "Mr. Dorian Gray's, sir," the policeman replied.
tr_translation: Adam said, "Mr. Dorian Gray, sir."
es_translation: —Mr. Dorian Gray—replied the policeman.

en: They looked at each other, as they walked away, and sneered. One of them was Sir Henry Ashton’s uncle.
vi: Họ nhìn nhau lúc họ bước đi và cười khinh bỉ. Một trong hai người là chú của ngài Henry Ashton.
tr: Beyler bakıştılar, dudaklarını bir küçümsemeyle bükerek oradan uzaklaştılar. İçlerinden biri Sir Henry Ashton’un akrabasıydı.
es: Las dos personas que le escuchaban intercambiaron una mirada de inteligencia y, mientras se alejaban, había en su rostro una mueca de desprecio. Uno de ellos era tío de sir Henry Ashton.
vi_translation: They looked at each other as they walked and laughed scornfully. One of the two was Sir Henry Ashton's uncle.
tr_translation: The gentlemen exchanged glances, curling their lips in disdain as they walked away. One of them was a relative of Sir Henry Ashton.
es_translation: The two people who were listening to him exchanged a knowing glance and, as they walked away, there was a sneer of contempt on their faces. One of them was Sir Henry Ashton's uncle.
